Categories 1 to 9 do not control “software” that meets any of the following descriptions: (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: “Software” that is generally available to the public by being: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.name: a
subsection.leadIn: Sold from stock at retail selling points without restriction, by means of:

paragraph.content: Over-the-counter transactions;
Mail order transactions; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Electronic transactions; or (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Telephone call transactions; and (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: Designed for installation by the user without further substantial support by the supplier; (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Entry (1) of the General Software Note does not release “software” specified in Category 5—Part 2 (“Information Security”). (L.N. 42 of 2017)

section.name: s2
section.content: “Software” that is “in the public domain”; (L.N. 183 of 1999; L.N. 42 of 2017)

section.name: s3
section.content: The “object code” that is the minimum necessary for the installation, operation, maintenance (checking) or repair of items whose export has been authorized.
Entry (3) of the General Software Note does not release “software” specified in Category 5—Part 2 (“Information Security”). (L.N. 42 of 2017)

section.name: s0
section.content: “Information security” items or functions should be considered against the provisions in Category 5—Part 2, even if they are components, “software” or functions of other items.

section.name: s0
section.content: Systems, Equipment and Components

subsection.leadIn: “Nuclear reactors” and specially designed or prepared equipment and components therefor, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: Metal vessels, or major shop-fabricated parts therefor, specially designed or prepared to contain the core of a “nuclear reactor”; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Manipulative equipment specially designed or prepared for inserting or removing fuel in a “nuclear reactor”;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: Pressure tubes specially designed or prepared to contain both fuel elements and the primary coolant in a “nuclear reactor”; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: For zirconium pressure tubes, see 0A001(e) and for calandria tubes, see 0A001(h). (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Coolant pumps or circulators specially designed or prepared for circulating the primary coolant of “nuclear reactors”; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: ‘Nuclear reactor internals’ specially designed or prepared for use in a “nuclear reactor”, including support columns for the core, fuel channels, calandria tubes, thermal shields, baffles, core grid plates, and diffuser plates; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

In 0A001(h), ‘nuclear reactor internals’ means any major structure within a reactor vessel which has one or more functions such as supporting the core, maintaining fuel alignment, directing primary coolant flow, providing radiation shields for the reactor vessel, and guiding in-core instrumentation. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: Heat exchangers as follows:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Steam generators specially designed or prepared for the primary, or intermediate, coolant circuit of a “nuclear reactor”; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Other heat exchangers specially designed or prepared for use in the primary coolant circuit of a “nuclear reactor”;

paragraph.continued: 0A001(i) does not control heat exchangers for the supporting systems of the reactor (e.g. the emergency cooling system or the decay heat cooling system). (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: Neutron detectors specially designed or prepared for determining neutron flux levels within the core of a “nuclear reactor”; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: In 0A001(k), ‘external thermal shields’ means major structures placed over the reactor vessel that reduce heat loss from the reactor and reduce temperature within the containment vessel. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

section.name: s0
section.content: Test, Inspection and Production Equipment

subsection.leadIn: Plant for the separation of isotopes of “natural uranium”, “depleted uranium” or “special fissile materials”, and specially designed or prepared equipment and components therefor, as follows: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Plant specially designed for separating isotopes of “natural uranium”, “depleted uranium”, or “special fissile materials”, as follows: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: Gas centrifuge separation plant;
Gaseous diffusion separation plant;
Aerodynamic separation plant;
Chemical exchange separation plant;
Ion-exchange separation plant;
Atomic vapour “laser” isotope separation plant;
Molecular “laser” isotope separation plant;
Plasma separation plant;
Electro magnetic separation plant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Gas centrifuges and assemblies and components, specially designed or prepared for gas centrifuge separation process, as follows:

continued.leadIn: In 0B001(b), ‘high strength-to-density ratio material’ means any of the following items:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Maraging steel capable of an ultimate tensile strength of 1.95 GPa or more;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Aluminium alloys capable of an ultimate tensile strength of 0.46 GPa or more;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: “Fibrous or filamentary materials” with a “specific modulus” of more than 3.18 × 106 m and a “specific tensile strength” greater than 7.62 × 104 m. (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Gas centrifuges;
Complete rotor assemblies;

Rings or bellows with a wall thickness of 3 mm or less and a diameter of between 75 mm and 650 mm and designed to give local support to a rotor tube or to join a number together, made from ‘high strength-to-density ratio materials’;

subparagraph.leadIn: Magnetic suspension bearings as follows:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Bearing assemblies consisting of an annular magnet suspended within a housing made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6” containing a damping medium and having the magnet coupling with a pole piece or second magnet fitted to the top cap of the rotor;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Active magnetic bearings specially designed or prepared for use with gas centrifuges; (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Specially prepared bearings comprising a pivot-cup assembly mounted on a damper;
Molecular pumps comprised of cylinders having internally machined or extruded helical grooves and internally machined bores;
Ring-shaped motor stators for multiphase AC hysteresis (or reluctance) motors for synchronous operation within a vacuum at a frequency of 600 Hz or more and a power of 40 Volt-Amps or more;

Centrifuge housing or centrifuge recipients to contain the rotor tube assembly of a gas centrifuge, consisting of a rigid cylinder of wall thickness up to 30 mm with precision machined ends that are parallel to each other and perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of cylinder to within 0.05 degrees or less;

Scoops consisting of specially designed or prepared tubes for the extraction of UF6 gas from within the rotor tube by a Pitot tube action and capable of being fixed to the central gas extraction system; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.leadIn: Frequency changers (converters or inverters) specially designed or prepared to supply motor stators for gas centrifuge enrichment, having all of the following characteristics, and specially designed components therefor:

subparagraph.name: a
b

subparagraph.leadIn: Shut-off and control valves as follows:

subparagraph.name: a
b
subparagraph.content: Bellows-sealed valves, shut-off or control, made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”, with an inside diameter of 10 mm to 160 mm, specially designed or prepared for use in main or auxiliary systems of gas centrifuge enrichment plants; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, specially designed or prepared for gaseous diffusion separation process, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Gaseous diffusion barriers made of porous metallic, polymer or ceramic “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6” with a pore size of 10 to 100 nm, a thickness of 5 mm or less, and, for tubular forms, a diameter of 25 mm or less;
Gaseous diffuser housings made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”;

Compressors or gas blowers with a suction volume capacity of 1 m3/min or more of UF6 that discharge pressure up to 500 kPa, have a pressure ratio of 10:1 or less, and are made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”;
Rotary shaft seals for compressors or blowers controlled by 0B001(c)(3) and designed for a buffer gas in-leakage rate of less than 1 000 cm3/min;
Heat exchangers made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”, and designed for a leakage pressure rate of less than 10 Pa per hour under a pressure differential of 100 kPa;
Bellows-sealed valves, manual or automated, shut-off or control, made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, specially designed or prepared for aerodynamic separation process, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Separation nozzles consisting of slit-shaped, curved channels having a radius of curvature less than 1 mm, resistant to corrosion by UF6, and having a knife-edge contained within the nozzle which separates the gas flowing through the nozzle into two streams;
Cylindrical or conical tubes (vortex tubes), made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”, with one or more tangential inlets; (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Heat exchangers made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”;
Bellows-sealed valves, manual or automated, shut-off or control, made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”, with a diameter of 40 mm or more; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.leadIn: Process systems for separating UF6 from carrier gas (hydrogen or helium) to 1 ppm UF6 content or less, including:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Cryogenic heat exchangers and cryoseparators capable of temperatures of 153 K (-120°C) or less;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Cryogenic refrigeration units capable of temperatures of 153 K (-120°C) or less;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Separation nozzle or vortex tube units for the separation of UF6 from carrier gas;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: UF6 cold traps capable of freezing out UF6;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, specially designed or prepared for chemical exchange separation process, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Fast-exchange liquid-liquid pulse columns with stage residence time of 30 seconds or less and resistant to concentrated hydrochloric acid (e.g. made of or protected by suitable plastic materials such as fluorinated hydrocarbon polymers or glass);

Fast-exchange liquid-liquid centrifugal contactors with stage residence time of 30 seconds or less and resistant to concentrated hydrochloric acid (e.g. made of or protected by suitable plastic materials such as fluorinated hydrocarbon polymers or glass);

Electrochemical reduction cells feed equipment to take U+4 from the organic stream and, for those parts in contact with the process stream, made of or protected by suitable material (e.g. glass, fluorocarbon polymers, polyphenyl sulphate, polyether sulfone and resin-impregnated graphite); (L.N. 85 of 2023)

Feed preparation systems for producing high purity uranium chloride solution consisting of dissolution, solvent extraction and/or ion exchange equipment for purification and electrolytic cells for reducing the uranium U+6 or U+4 to U+3;
Uranium oxidation systems for oxidation of U+3 to U+4;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, specially designed or prepared for ion-exchange separation process, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Fast reacting ion-exchange resins, pellicular or porous macro-reticulated resins in which the active chemical exchange groups are limited to a coating on the surface of an inactive porous support structure, and other composite structures in any suitable form, including particles or fibres, with diameters of 0.2 mm or less, resistant to concentrated hydrochloric acid and designed to have an exchange rate half-time of less than 10 seconds and capable of operating at temperatures in the range of 373 K (100°C) to 473 K (200°C);

Ion exchange columns (cylindrical) with a diameter greater than 1 000 mm, made of or protected by materials resistant to concentrated hydrochloric acid (e.g. titanium or fluorocarbon plastics) and capable of operating at temperatures in the range of 373 K (100°C) to 473 K (200°C) and pressures above 0.7 MPa;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, specially designed or prepared for laser-based separation processes using atomic vapour laser isotope separation, as follows: (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Uranium metal vaporization systems designed to achieve a delivered power of 1 kW or more on the target for use in laser enrichment;

Liquid or vapour uranium metal handling systems specially designed or prepared for handling molten uranium, molten uranium alloys or uranium metal vapour for use in laser enrichment, and specially designed components for such systems;
See also 2A225.

Product and tails collector assemblies for collecting uranium metal in liquid or solid form, made of or protected by materials resistant to the heat and corrosion of uranium metal vapour or liquid, such as yttria-coated graphite or tantalum;
Separator module housings (cylindrical or rectangular vessels) for containing the uranium metal vapour source, the electron beam gun and the product and tails collectors;
See also 6A005 and 6A205. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, specially designed or prepared for laser-based separation processes using molecular laser isotope separation, as follows: (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Product or tails collector components or devices, specially designed or prepared for collecting uranium material or uranium tails material following illumination with laser light, made of “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”; (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)
Compressors made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”, and rotary shaft seals therefor;
Equipment for fluorinating UF5 (solid) to UF6 (gas);

subparagraph.leadIn: Process systems for separating UF6 from carrier gas (e.g. nitrogen, argon or other gases) including: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: a
b
subparagraph.content: Cryogenic refrigeration units capable of temperatures of 153 K (-120°C) or less;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: UF6 cold traps capable of freezing out UF6;
See also 6A005 and 6A205.

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, specially designed or prepared for plasma separation process, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Radio frequency ion excitation coils for frequencies of more than 100 kHz and capable of handling more than 40 kW mean power;
Uranium plasma-generation systems;

Product and tails collector assemblies for uranium metal in solid form, made of or protected by materials resistant to the heat and corrosion of uranium vapour such as yttria-coated graphite or tantalum;

Separator module housings (cylindrical) for containing the uranium plasma source, radio-frequency drive coil and the product and tails collectors and made of a suitable non-magnetic material (e.g. stainless steel);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, specially designed or prepared for electromagnetic separation process, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Ion sources, single or multiple, consisting of a vapour source, ionizer, and beam accelerator made of suitable non-magnetic materials (e.g. graphite, stainless steel, or copper) and capable of providing a total ion beam current of 50 mA or greater;

Ion collector plates for collection of enriched or depleted uranium ion beams, consisting of two or more slits and pockets and made of suitable non-magnetic materials (e.g. graphite or stainless steel);
Magnet pole pieces with a diameter greater than 2 m;

subparagraph.leadIn: High voltage power supplies for ion sources, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Capable of continuous operation;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Output voltage of 20 000 V or greater;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Output current of 1 A or greater; and

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Voltage regulation of better than 0.01% over a period of 8 hours;

subparagraph.continued: See also 3A227.

subparagraph.leadIn: Magnet power supplies (high power, direct current) having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Capable of continuous operation with a current output of 500 A or greater at a voltage of 100 V or greater; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Current or voltage regulation better than 0.01% over a period of 8 hours;

subparagraph.continued: See also 3A226.

subsection.leadIn: Specially designed or prepared auxiliary systems, equipment and components, as follows, for isotope separation plant controlled by 0B001, made of or protected by “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Feed autoclaves, ovens or systems used for passing UF6 to the enrichment process;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Desublimers or cold traps, used to remove UF6 from the enrichment process for subsequent transfer upon heating;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Product and tails stations for transferring UF6 into containers;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: Piping systems and header systems specially designed or prepared for handling UF6 within gaseous diffusion, centrifuge or aerodynamic cascades; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: Vacuum systems and pumps as follows:

subparagraph.content: Vacuum manifolds, vacuum headers or vacuum pumps having a suction capacity of 5 m3/min or more;
Vacuum pumps specially designed for use in UF6 bearing atmospheres made of, or protected by, “materials resistant to corrosion by UF6”; or
Vacuum systems consisting of vacuum manifolds, vacuum headers and vacuum pumps, and designed for service in UF6 bearing atmospheres; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: UF6 mass spectrometers/ion sources capable of taking on-line samples from UF6 gas streams and meeting all of the following descriptions:

subparagraph.content: Capable of measuring ions of 320 atomic mass units or greater and having a resolution of better than 1 part in 320; (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Electron bombardment ionization sources;

subsection.leadIn: Plant for the conversion of uranium and equipment specially designed or prepared therefor, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of uranium ore concentrates to UO3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of UO3 to UF6;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of UO3 to UO2;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of UO2 to UF4;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of UF4 to UF6;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of UF4 to uranium metal;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of UF6 to UO2;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of UF6 to UF4;

paragraph.name: i

subsection.leadIn: Plant for the production or concentration of heavy water, deuterium and deuterium compounds and specially designed or prepared equipment and components therefor, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Plant for the production of heavy water, deuterium or deuterium compounds, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Water-hydrogen sulphide exchange plants;
Ammonia-hydrogen exchange plants;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and components, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Water-hydrogen sulphide exchange towers with diameters of 1.5 m or more, capable of operating at pressures equal to or greater than 2 MPa; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

Single stage, low head (i.e. 0.2 MPa) centrifugal blowers or compressors for hydrogen sulphide gas circulation (i.e. gas containing more than 70% by weight hydrogen sulphide, H2S) with a throughput capacity greater than or equal to 56 m3/second when operating at pressures greater than or equal to 1.8 MPa suction and having seals designed for wet H2S service; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
Infrared absorption analysers capable of on-line hydrogen/deuterium ratio analysis where deuterium concentrations are equal to or greater than 90% by weight; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
Catalytic burners for the conversion of enriched deuterium gas into heavy water utilizing the ammonia-hydrogen exchange process;
Ammonia synthesis converters or synthesis units specially designed or prepared for heavy water production utilizing the ammonia-hydrogen exchange process; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Plant specially designed for the fabrication of “nuclear reactor” fuel elements and specially designed or prepared equipment therefor;
subsection.continued: Specially designed or prepared equipment for the fabrication of “nuclear reactor” fuel elements includes equipment which: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Normally comes into direct contact with or directly processes or controls the production flow of nuclear materials;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Seals the nuclear materials within the cladding;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Checks the integrity of the cladding or the seal; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Checks the finish treatment of the sealed fuel; or (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Is used for assembling reactor elements. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Plant for the reprocessing of irradiated “nuclear reactor” fuel elements, and specially designed or prepared equipment and components therefor;
0B006 includes:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Plant for the reprocessing of irradiated “nuclear reactor” fuel elements including equipment and components which normally come into direct contact with and directly control the irradiated fuel and the major nuclear material and fission product processing streams;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Fuel element decladding equipment and chopping or shredding machines, i.e. remotely operated equipment to cut, chop or shear irradiated “nuclear reactor” fuel assemblies, bundles or rods; (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Dissolver vessels or dissolvers employing mechanical devices specially designed or prepared for the dissolution of irradiated “nuclear reactor” fuel, which are capable of withstanding hot, highly corrosive liquids, and which can be remotely loaded, operated and maintained; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Solvent extractors, such as packed or pulsed columns, mixer settlers or centrifugal contactors, resistant to the corrosive effects of nitric acid and specially designed or prepared for use in a plant for the reprocessing of irradiated “natural uranium”, “depleted uranium” or “special fissile materials”; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: Holding or storage vessels specially designed to be critically safe and resistant to the corrosive effects of nitric acid;
Holding or storage vessels may have the following features:

subparagraph.content: A maximum diameter of 175 mm for cylindrical vessels; or
A maximum width of 75 mm for either a slab or annular vessel.

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Neutron measurement systems specially designed or prepared for integration and use with automated process control systems in a plant for the reprocessing of irradiated “natural uranium”, “depleted uranium” or “special fissile materials”. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Plant for the conversion of plutonium and equipment specially designed or prepared therefor, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Systems for the conversion of plutonium nitrate to oxide;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Systems for plutonium metal production; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

section.name: s0
section.content: Materials

subsection.leadIn: 0C001 does not control the following:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Four grammes or less of “natural uranium” or “depleted uranium” when contained in a sensing component in instruments;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: “Depleted uranium” specially fabricated for the following civil non-nuclear applications:

subparagraph.content: Shielding;
Packaging;
Ballasts having a mass not greater than 100 kg;
Counter-weights having a mass not greater than 100 kg;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Alloys containing less than 5% thorium;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Ceramic products containing thorium, which have been manufactured for non-nuclear use.

subsection.content: “Special fissile materials”;
0C002 does not control four “effective grammes” or less when contained in a sensing component in instruments.

subsection.leadIn: Graphite having a purity level better than 5 parts per million ‘boron equivalent’ and with a density greater than 1.5 g/cm3 for use in a “nuclear reactor”, and in quantities exceeding 1 kg; (L.N. 42 of 2017)
See also 1C107.

paragraph.content: For the purpose of export control, the competent authorities of the “Participating State” in which the exporter is established will determine whether or not the exports of graphite meeting the above specifications are for “nuclear reactor” use. 0C004 does not control graphite having a purity level better than 5 ppm (parts per million) boron equivalent and with a density greater than 1.5 g/cm3 not for use in a “nuclear reactor”. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)
In 0C004, ‘boron equivalent’ (BE) is defined as the sum of BEZ for impurities (excluding BEcarbon since carbon is not considered an impurity) including boron, where:

BEZ(ppm) = CF × concentration of element Z in ppm;
where CF is the conversion factor = σZAB
σBAZ
and σB and σz are the thermal neutron capture cross sections (in barns) for naturally occurring boron and element Z respectively; and AB and AZ are the atomic masses of naturally occurring boron and element Z respectively. (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subsection.content: Specially prepared compounds or powders for the manufacture of gaseous diffusion barriers, resistant to corrosion by UF6 (e.g. nickel or alloys containing 60% or more by weight of nickel, aluminium oxide and fully fluorinated hydrocarbon polymers), having a purity of 99.9% by weight or more and a particle size less than 10 μm measured by American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) B330 standard and a high degree of particle size uniformity;

section.name: s0
section.content: Software

subsection.content: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “development”, “production” or “use” of goods controlled by this Category;

section.name: s0
section.content: Technology

section.name: s0
section.content: Systems, Equipment and Components

subsection.leadIn: Components made from fluorinated compounds, as follows: (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a

subsection.leadIn: “Composite” structures or laminates, as follows: (L.N. 89 of 2021)
See also 1A202, 9A010 and 9A110.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Made from any of the following:

subparagraph.content: An organic “matrix” and “fibrous or filamentary materials” specified in 1C010(c) or 1C010(d);
Prepregs or preforms specified in 1C010(e); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Made from a metal or carbon “matrix”, and any of the following: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.leadIn: Carbon “fibrous or filamentary materials” having:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A “specific modulus” exceeding 10.15 × 106 m; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: A “specific tensile strength” exceeding 17.7 × 104 m;
Materials specified in 1C010(c); (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.leadIn: 1A002 does not apply to “composite” structures or laminates, made from epoxy resin impregnated carbon “fibrous or filamentary materials”, for the repair of “civil aircraft” structures or laminates, having all of the following: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: An area not exceeding 1 m2;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: A length not exceeding 2.5 m;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: A width exceeding 15 mm. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.leadIn: 1A002 does not apply to semi-finished items, specially designed for purely civilian applications as follows: (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Sporting goods;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Automotive industry;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Machine tool industry; and

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Medical applications. (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.leadIn: 1A002(b)(1) does not apply to semi-finished items that contain a maximum of two dimensions of interwoven filaments and are specially designed for applications as follows: (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Metal heat-treatment furnaces for tempering metals; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Silicon boule production equipment. (L.N. 226 of 2009)

paragraph.content: 1A002 does not apply to finished items specially designed for a specific application. (L.N. 161 of 2011)
1A002(b)(1) does not apply to mechanically chopped, milled, or cut carbon “fibrous or filamentary materials” 25.0 mm or less in length. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Manufactures of non-“fusible” aromatic polyimides in film, sheet, tape or ribbon form having any of the following: (L.N. 226 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: With a thickness exceeding 0.254 mm; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Coated or laminated with carbon, graphite, metals or magnetic substances;

continued.content: 1A003 does not control manufactures when coated or laminated with copper and designed for the “production” of electronic printed circuit boards. (L.N. 6 of 2025)
For “fusible” aromatic polyimides in any form, see 1C008(a)(3). (L.N. 226 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: Protective and detection equipment and components, not specially designed for military use, as follows:
See also the Munitions List, 2B351 and 2B352. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Full face masks, filter canisters and decontamination equipment for such masks and canisters, designed or modified for defence against any of the following, and specially designed components for such masks, canisters and equipment: (L.N. 42 of 2017)
1A004(a) includes Powered Air Purifying Respirators (PAPR) that are designed or modified for defence against agents or materials, listed in 1A004(a). (L.N. 89 of 2013)
For the purposes of 1A004(a):

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Full face masks are also known as gas masks;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Filter canisters include filter cartridges. (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Chemical warfare (CW) agents;

subparagraph.leadIn: “Riot control agents”, including:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: α-Bromobenzeneacetonitrile, (Bromobenzyl cyanide) (CA) (CAS 5798-79-8);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: [(2-chlorophenyl) methylene] propanedinitrile, (o-Chlorobenzylidenemalononitrile) (CS) (CAS 2698-41-1); (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: 2-Chloro-1-phenylethanone, Phenylacyl chloride (ω-chloroacetophenone) (CN) (CAS 532-27-4);

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Dibenz-(b,f)-1,4-oxazephine, (CR) (CAS 257-07-8);

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: 10-Chloro-5,10-dihydrophenarsazine, (Phenarsazine chloride), (Adamsite), (DM) (CAS 578-94-9); (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: f
subparagraph.content: N-Nonanoylmorpholine, (MPA) (CAS 5299-64-9);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Protective suits, gloves and shoes specially designed or modified for defence against any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Chemical warfare (CW) agents; (L.N. 226 of 2009)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Detection systems, specially designed or modified for detection or identification of any of the following, and specially designed components for those systems: (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.content: Chemical warfare (CW) agents; and (L.N. 226 of 2009)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Electronic equipment designed for automatically detecting or identifying the presence of “explosives” residues and utilizing ‘trace detection’ techniques (e.g. surface acoustic wave, ion mobility spectrometry, differential mobility spectrometry and mass spectrometry);
‘Trace detection’ is defined as the capability to detect less than 1 ppm vapour, or 1 mg solid or liquid. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: 1A004(d) does not include equipment specially designed for laboratory use.
1A004(d) does not include non-contact walk-through security portals. (L.N. 226 of 2009)

subsection.continued: 1A004 does not include:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Personal radiation monitoring dosimeters; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Occupational health or safety equipment limited by design or function to protect against hazards specific to residential safety or civil industries, including: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: Mining;
Quarrying;
Agriculture;
Pharmaceutical;
Medical;
Veterinary;
Environmental;
Waste management;
Food industry. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.content: 1A004 includes equipment and components that have been identified, successfully tested to national standards or otherwise proven effective, for the detection of or defence against ‘radioactive materials’, “biological agents”, chemical warfare agents, ‘simulants’ or “riot control agents”, even if such equipment or components are used in civil industries, such as mining, quarrying, agriculture, pharmaceuticals, medical, veterinary, environmental, waste management, or in the food industry. (L.N. 89 of 2021)
‘Simulant’: a substance or material that is used in place of toxic agent (chemical or biological) in training, research, testing or evaluation.

For the purposes of 1A004, ‘radioactive materials’ are those selected or modified to increase their effectiveness in producing casualties in humans or animals, degrading equipment or damaging crops or the environment. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Body armour and its components, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Soft body armour not manufactured to military standards or specifications, or to their equivalents, and its specially designed components;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Hard body armour plates providing ballistic protection equal to or less than level IIIA (NIJ 0101.06, July 2008) or “equivalent standards”; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
For “fibrous or filamentary materials” used in the manufacture of body armour, see 1C010.
For body armour manufactured to military standards or specifications, see ML13(d). (L.N. 85 of 2023)
1A005 does not apply to body armour when accompanying its user for the user’s own personal protection.
1A005 does not apply to body armour designed to provide frontal protection only from both fragment and blast from non-military explosive devices.
1A005 does not apply to body armour designed to provide protection only from knife, spike, needle or blunt trauma.

subsection.leadIn: Equipment, specially designed or modified for the disposal of Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs), as follows, and specially designed components and accessories for those equipment: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Remotely operated vehicles; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ‘Disruptors’;

continued.content: For the purposes of 1A006(b), ‘disruptors’ are devices specially designed for the purpose of preventing the operation of an explosive device by projecting a liquid, solid or frangible projectile. (L.N. 85 of 2023)
For equipment specially designed for military use for the disposal of IEDs, see also ML4. (L.N. 85 of 2023)
1A006 does not include equipment when accompanying its operator.

subsection.leadIn: Equipment and devices, specially designed to initiate charges, and devices containing “energetic materials”, by electrical means, as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Explosive detonator firing sets designed to drive explosive detonators specified in 1A007(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Electrically driven explosive detonators, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Exploding bridge (EB);
Exploding bridge wire (EBW);
Slapper; and
Exploding foil initiators (EFI);

paragraph.content: The word initiator or igniter is sometimes used in place of the word detonator.

For the purpose of 1A007(b) the detonators of concern all utilize a small electrical conductor (bridge, bridge wire, or foil) that explosively vaporizes when a fast, high-current electrical pulse is passed through it. In non-slapper types, the exploding conductor starts a chemical detonation in a contacting high explosive material such as PETN (pentaerythritoltetranitrate). In slapper detonators, the explosive vaporization of the electrical conductor drives a flyer or slapper across a gap, and the impact of the slapper on an explosive starts a chemical detonation. The slapper in some designs is driven by magnetic force. The term exploding foil detonator may refer to either an EB or a slapper-type detonator. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.continued: For equipment and devices specially designed for military use, see the Munitions List. See also 3A229 and 3A232. (L.N. 226 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: Charges, devices and components, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: ‘Shaped charges’ having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g;
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and specially designed components for those cutting charges:

subparagraph.content: An explosive load greater than 40 g/m;
A width of 10 mm or more;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;

paragraph.name: d

subsection.continued: The term ‘shaped charges’ means explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.

subsection.content: Resaturated pyrolized carbon-carbon components designed for space launch vehicles controlled by 9A004 or sounding rockets controlled by 9A104;

subsection.leadIn: Composite structures, other than those controlled by 1A002, in the form of tubes and having both of the following characteristics: (L.N. 95 of 2006)
See also 9A010 and 9A110.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: An inside diameter of between 75 mm and 400 mm; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Made with any of the “fibrous or filamentary materials” controlled by 1C010(a) or 1C010(b) or 1C210(a) or with carbon prepreg materials controlled by 1C210(c); (L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Specialized packings which may be used in separating heavy water from ordinary water, having both of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Made of phosphor bronze mesh chemically treated to improve wettability; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Designed to be used in vacuum distillation towers; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: High-density (lead glass or other) radiation shielding windows, having all of the following characteristics, and specially designed frames therefor:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A ‘cold area’ greater than 0.09 m2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: A density greater than 3 g/cm3; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: A thickness of 100 mm or greater;

subsection.continued: In 1A227, the term ‘cold area’ means the viewing area of the window exposed to the lowest level of radiation in the design application. (L.N. 132 of 2001)

section.name: s0
section.content: Test, Inspection and Production Equipment

subsection.leadIn: Equipment designed for the “production” of “composite” structures or laminates or “fibrous or filamentary materials”, as follows, and specially designed components and accessories therefor: (L.N. 161 of 2011; L.N. 6 of 2025)
See also 1B101 and 1B201.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Filament winding machines, of which the motions for positioning, wrapping and winding fibres are coordinated and programmed in three or more ‘primary servo positioning’ axes, specially designed for the manufacture of “composite” structures or laminates from “fibrous or filamentary materials”; (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ‘Tape-laying machines’, of which the motions for positioning and laying tape are coordinated and programmed in five or more ‘primary servo positioning’ axes, specially designed for the manufacture of “composite” airframe or ‘missile’ structures; (L.N. 161 of 2011; L.N. 42 of 2017)
In 1B001(b), ‘missile’ means complete rocket systems and unmanned aerial vehicle systems. (L.N. 254 of 2008)

For the purposes of 1B001(b), ‘tape-laying machines’ have the ability to lay one or more ‘filament bands’ limited to widths greater than 25.4 mm and equal to or less than 304.8 mm, and to cut and restart individual ‘filament band’ courses during the laying process. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Multidirectional, multidimensional weaving machines or interlacing machines, including adapters and modification kits, specially designed or modified for weaving, interlacing or braiding fibres for “composite” structures; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
For the purpose of 1B001(c) the technique of interlacing includes knitting. (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment specially designed or modified for the “production” of “fibrous or filamentary materials” specified in 1C010, as follows: (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: Equipment for converting polymeric fibres (such as polyacrylonitrile, rayon, pitch or polycarbosilane) into carbon fibres or silicon carbide fibres, including special equipment to strain the fibre during heating;
Equipment for the wet-spinning of refractory ceramics (such as aluminium oxide);
Equipment for converting aluminium containing precursor fibres into alumina fibres by heat treatment;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Equipment specially designed or modified for the “production” of prepregs by the ‘hot melt method’;

For the purposes of 1B001(e), the ‘hot melt method’ is the process of applying pressure and heat to impregnate “fibrous or filamentary materials” with resin that has been pre-laminated onto a carrier substrate, such as film or paper. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: Non-destructive inspection equipment specially designed for “composite” materials, as follows:

subparagraph.content: X-ray tomography systems for three dimensional defect inspection; and

Numerically controlled ultrasonic testing machines of which the motions for positioning transmitters or receivers
are simultaneously coordinated and programmed in four or more axes to follow the three dimensional contours of the component under inspection; (L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: ‘Tow-placement machines’, of which the motions for positioning and laying tows are coordinated and programmed in two or more ‘primary servo positioning’ axes, specially designed for the manufacture of “composite” airframe or missile structures; (L.N. 161 of 2011; L.N. 42 of 2017)

For the purposes of 1B001(g), ‘tow-placement machines’ have the ability to place one or more ‘filament bands’ having widths equal to or less than 25.4 mm, and to cut and restart individual ‘filament band’ courses during the placement process. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021)

For the purposes of 1B001, ‘primary servo positioning’ axes control, under computer “program” direction, the position of the end effector (i.e. head) in space relative to the work piece at the correct orientation and direction to achieve the desired process. (L.N. 161 of 2011; L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 6 of 2025)

For the purposes of 1B001, ‘filament band’ is a single continuous width of fully or partially resin-impregnated tape, tow or fibre. Fully or partially resin-impregnated ‘filament bands’ include those coated with dry powder that tacks on heating. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021; L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Equipment designed to produce metal alloy powder or particulate materials, and having all of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Specially designed to avoid contamination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Specially designed for use in one of the processes specified in 1C002(c)(2); (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.continued:
N.B.:
See also 1B102. (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: Tools, dies, moulds or fixtures, for “superplastic forming” or “diffusion bonding” titanium, aluminium or their alloys, specially designed for the manufacture of any of the following: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Airframe or aerospace structures;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: Specially designed components for structures specified in 1B003(a) or for engines specified in 1B003(b); (L.N. 226 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: Equipment, other than that controlled by 1B001, for the “production” of structural composites as follows; and specially designed components and accessories therefor:
See also 1B201.

Components and accessories controlled by 1B101 include moulds, mandrels, dies, fixtures and tooling for the preform pressing, curing, casting, sintering or bonding of composite structures, laminates and manufactures thereof.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Filament winding machines or fibre placement machines, of which the motions for positioning, wrapping and winding fibres can be coordinated and programmed in three or more axes, designed to fabricate composite structures or laminates from “fibrous or filamentary materials”, and coordinating and programming controls; (L.N. 226 of 2009; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Tape-laying machines of which the motions for positioning and laying tape and sheets can be coordinated and programmed in two or more axes, designed for the manufacture of composite airframe and “missile” structures;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment designed or modified for the “production” of “fibrous or filamentary materials” as follows:

subparagraph.content: Equipment for the vapour deposition of elements or compounds on heated filament substrates; and
Equipment for the wet-spinning of refractory ceramics (such as aluminium oxide);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Equipment designed or modified for special fibre surface treatment or for producing prepregs and preforms controlled by 9C110; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
1B101(d) includes rollers, tension stretchers, coating equipment, cutting equipment and clicker dies. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Metal powder “production equipment”, other than that controlled by 1B002, and components as follows: (L.N. 95 of 2006)
See also 1B115(b).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Metal powder “production equipment” usable for the “production”, in a controlled environment, of spherical, spheroidal or atomized materials specified in 1C011(a), 1C011(b), 1C111(a)(1), 1C111(a)(2) or in the Munitions List; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Specially designed components for “production equipment” controlled by 1B002 or 1B102(a); (L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: 1B102 includes:

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: Equipment usable for the “production” of spherical aluminium powders by powdering a melt in an inert medium (e.g. nitrogen).

subsection.leadIn: Equipment, other than that controlled by 1B002 or 1B102, for the production of propellants or propellant constituents, as follows, and specially designed components therefor: (L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: “Production equipment” for the “production”, handling, mixing, curing, casting, pressing, machining, extruding or acceptance testing of solid propellants or propellant constituents controlled by 1C011(a), 1C011(b), 1C111 or in the Munitions List; (L.N. 95 of 2006)
1B115(b) does not control batch mixers, continuous mixers or fluid energy mills. For the control of batch mixers, continuous mixers and fluid energy mills, see 1B117, 1B118 and 1B119.
For equipment specially designed for the production of military goods, see the Munitions List.
1B115 does not control equipment for the “production”, handling and acceptance testing of boron carbide.

subsection.content: Specially designed nozzles for producing pyrolitically derived materials formed on a mould, mandrel or other substrate from precursor gases which decompose in the 1 573 K (1 300°C) to 3 173 K (2 900°C) temperature range at pressures of 130 Pa to 20 kPa;

subsection.leadIn: Batch mixers having all of the following characteristics, and specially designed components for the batch mixers:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Designed or modified for mixing under vacuum in the range of zero to 13.326 kPa;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Capable of controlling the temperature of the mixing chamber;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: A total volumetric capacity of 110 litres or more;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: At least one ‘mixing or kneading shaft’ mounted off centre;
In 1B117(d), the term ‘mixing or kneading shaft’ does not refer to deagglomerators or knife-spindles. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Continuous mixers having all of the following characteristics, and specially designed components for the continuous mixers:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Designed or modified for mixing under vacuum in the range of zero to 13.326 kPa;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Capable of controlling the temperature of the mixing chamber;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Having either:

subparagraph.content: Two or more mixing/kneading shafts; or

subsection.leadIn: Filament winding machines, other than those controlled by 1B001 or 1B101, and related equipment, as follows: (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Filament winding machines having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Having motions for positioning, wrapping, and winding fibres coordinated and programmed in two or more axes;
Specially designed to fabricate composite structures or laminates from “fibrous or filamentary materials”; and
Capable of winding cylindrical tubes with an internal diameter between 75 mm and 650 mm and lengths of 300 mm or greater; (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Coordinating and programming controls for the filament winding machines controlled by 1B201(a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Precision mandrels for the filament winding machines controlled by 1B201(a); (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.content: Electrolytic cells for fluorine production with an output capacity greater than 250 g of fluorine per hour;

subsection.leadIn: 1B226 includes separators:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Capable of enriching stable isotopes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: With the ion sources and collectors both in the magnetic field and those configurations in which they are external to the field.

subsection.leadIn: Hydrogen-cryogenic distillation columns having all of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Designed to operate with internal temperatures of 35 K (-238°C) or less;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: Constructed of either:

subparagraph.content: Stainless steel of the Society of Automotive Engineers International (SAE) 300 series with low sulphur content and with an austenitic ASTM (or equivalent standard) grain size number of 5 or greater; or (L.N. 89 of 2021)
Equivalent materials which are both cryogenic and hydrogen (H2)-compatible; and (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: With internal diameters of 30 cm or greater and ‘effective lengths’ of 4 m or greater; (L.N. 42 of 2017)
In 1B228(d), ‘effective length’ means the active height of packing material in a packed-type column, or the active height of internal contactor plates in a plate-type column. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Pumps capable of circulating solutions of concentrated or dilute potassium amide catalyst in liquid ammonia (KNH2/NH3), having all of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Airtight (i.e. hermetically sealed); (E.R. 6 of 2020)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: A capacity greater than 8.5 m3/h; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Either of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: For concentrated potassium amide solutions (1% or greater), an operating pressure of 1.5 to 60 MPa; or
For dilute potassium amide solutions (less than 1%), an operating pressure of 20 to 60 MPa;

subsection.leadIn: Tritium facilities or plants, and equipment therefor, as follows: (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Facilities or plants for the production, recovery, extraction, concentration, or handling of tritium;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment for tritium facilities or plants, as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Hydrogen isotope storage or hydrogen isotope purification systems using metal hydrides as the storage, or purification medium;

subsection.leadIn: Turboexpanders or turboexpander-compressor sets having both of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Designed for operation with an outlet temperature of 35 K (-238°C) or less; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Designed for a throughput of hydrogen gas of 1 000 kg/h or greater;

subsection.leadIn: Lithium isotope separation facilities or plants, and systems and equipment therefor, as follows: (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment for the separation of lithium isotopes based on the lithium-mercury amalgam process, as follows: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: Packed liquid-liquid exchange columns specially designed for lithium amalgams;
Mercury or lithium amalgam pumps; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Lithium amalgam electrolysis cells;
Evaporators for concentrated lithium hydroxide solution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Ion exchange systems specially designed for lithium isotope separation, and specially designed components for such systems; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Chemical exchange systems (employing crown ethers, cryptands, or lariat ethers), specially designed for lithium isotope separation, and specially designed components for such systems; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: High explosive containment vessels, chambers, containers and other similar containment devices designed for the testing of high explosives or explosive devices that meet all of the following descriptions:
See also the Munitions List.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Designed to fully contain an explosion equivalent to 2 kg of trinitrotoluene (TNT) or greater; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Having design elements or features enabling real time or delayed transfer of diagnostic or measurement information;

subsection.leadIn: Target assemblies and components for the production of tritium as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Target assemblies made of or containing lithium enriched in the lithium-6 isotope specially designed for the production of tritium through irradiation, including insertion in a nuclear reactor; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Components specially designed for the target assemblies specified in 1B235(a);

subsection.continued: Components specially designed for target assemblies for the production of tritium may include lithium pellets, tritium getters, and specially-coated cladding.

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: Materials

subsection.leadIn: Metals and alloys:
Unless provision to the contrary is made, the words ‘metals’ and ‘alloys’ in 1C001 to 1C012 cover crude and semi-fabricated forms, as follows:
Crude forms:

Anodes, balls, bars (including notched bars and wire bars), billets, blocks, blooms, brickets, cakes, cathodes, crystals, cubes, dice, grains, granules, ingots, lumps, pellets, pigs, powder, rondelles, shot, slabs, slugs, sponge, sticks;
Semi-fabricated forms (whether or not coated, plated, drilled or punched):

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Wrought or worked materials fabricated by rolling, drawing, extruding, forging, impact extruding, pressing, graining, atomizing, and grinding, i.e.: angles, channels, circles, discs, dust, flakes, foils and leaf, forging, plate, powder, pressings and stampings, ribbons, rings, rods (including bare welding rods, wire rods, and rolled wire), sections, shapes, sheets, strip, pipe and tubes (including tube rounds, squares, and hollows), drawn or extruded wire; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Cast material produced by casting in sand, die, metal, plaster or other types of moulds, including high pressure castings, sintered forms, and forms made by powder metallurgy.

subsection.continued: The object of the control should not be defeated by the export of non-listed forms alleged to be finished products but representing in reality crude forms or semi-fabricated forms.

subsection.leadIn: Materials specially designed for absorbing electromagnetic radiation, or intrinsically conductive polymers, as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023)
See also 1C101.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Materials for absorbing frequencies exceeding 2 × 108 Hz but less than 3 × 1012 Hz;

subparagraph.leadIn: 1C001(a) does not control:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Hair type absorbers, constructed of natural or synthetic fibres, with non-magnetic loading to provide absorption;

subparagraph.name: b
c
subparagraph.leadIn: Planar absorbers, having all of the following characteristics:
Made from any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Plastic foam materials (flexible or non-flexible) with carbon-loading, or organic materials, including binders, providing more than 5% echo compared with metal over a bandwidth exceeding +15% of the centre frequency of the incident energy, and not capable of withstanding temperatures exceeding 450 K (177°C); or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Ceramic materials providing more than 20% echo compared with metal over a bandwidth exceeding +15% of the centre frequency of the incident energy, and not capable of withstanding temperatures exceeding 800 K (527°C);

subparagraph.continued: Absorption test samples for 1C001(a) Note 1(c)(1) should be a square at least 5 wavelengths of the centre frequency on a side and positioned in the far field of the radiating element.

subparagraph.content: Tensile strength less than 7 × 106 N/m2; and
Compressive strength less than 14 × 106 N/m2;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.leadIn: Planar absorbers made of sintered ferrite, having:

subparagraph.content: A specific gravity exceeding 4.4; and
A maximum operating temperature that is 548 K (275°C) or less; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Planar absorbers having no magnetic loss, and fabricated from ‘open-cell foam’ plastic material with a density of 0.15 g/cm3 or less.
‘Open-cell foams’ are flexible and porous materials, having an inner structure open to the atmosphere. ‘Open-cell foams’ are also known as reticulated foams. (L.N. 85 of 2023)
Nothing in Note 1 releases magnetic materials to provide absorption when contained in paint. (L.N. 132 of 2001)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Materials not transparent to visible light and specially designed for absorbing near-infrared radiation having a wavelength exceeding 810 nm but less than 2 000 nm (frequencies exceeding 1.5 × 1014 Hz but less than 3.7 × 1014 Hz); (L.N. 85 of 2023)

content.leadIn: 1C001(b) does not control materials that are specially designed or formulated for any of the following applications:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Laser” marking of polymers;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: “Laser” welding of polymers. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Intrinsically conductive polymeric materials with a ‘bulk electrical conductivity’ exceeding 10 000 S/m (Siemens per metre) or a ‘sheet (surface) resistivity’ of less than 100 ohms/square, based on any of the following polymers: (L.N. 95 of 2006)

subparagraph.content: Polyaniline;
Polypyrrole;
Polythiophene;
Poly phenylene-vinylene; or
Poly thienylene-vinylene;

paragraph.continued: 1C001(c) does not control materials in a liquid form. (L.N. 42 of 2017)
‘Bulk electrical conductivity’ and ‘sheet (surface) resistivity’ should be determined using ASTM D-257 or national equivalents. (L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Metal alloys, metal alloy powder and alloyed materials, as follows:
See also 1C202.
1C002 does not control metal alloys, metal alloy powder and alloyed materials, specially formulated for coating purposes. (L.N. 85 of 2023)
The metal alloys in 1C002 are those containing a higher percentage by weight of the stated metal than of any other element. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Aluminides, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Titanium aluminides containing 10 weight percent or more aluminium and at least one additional alloying element;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Metal alloys, as follows, made from the powder or particulate material specified by 1C002(c): (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.leadIn: Nickel alloys with:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A ‘stress-rupture life’ of 10 000 hours or longer at 923 K (650°C) at a stress of 676 MPa; or

subparagraph.name: b

subparagraph.leadIn: Niobium alloys with:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A ‘stress-rupture life’ of 10 000 hours or longer at 1 073 K (800°C) at a stress of 400 MPa; or

subparagraph.name: b

subparagraph.leadIn: Titanium alloys with:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A ‘stress-rupture life’ of 10 000 hours or longer at 723 K (450°C) at a stress of 200 MPa; or

subparagraph.name: b

subparagraph.leadIn: Aluminium alloys with a tensile strength of:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: 240 MPa or more at 473 K (200°C); or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: 415 MPa or more at 298 K (25°C);

subparagraph.leadIn: Magnesium alloys with:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A tensile strength of 345 MPa or more; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: A corrosion rate of less than 1 mm/year in 3% sodium chloride aqueous solution measured in accordance with ASTM standard G-31 or national equivalents; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
‘Stress-rupture life’ should be measured in accordance with ASTM standard E-139 or national equivalents.

‘Low cycle fatigue life’ should be measured in accordance with ASTM Standard E-606 ‘Recommended Practice for Constant-Amplitude Low-Cycle Fatigue Testing’ or national equivalents. Testing should be axial with an average stress ratio equal to 1 and a stress-concentration factor (Kt) equal to 1. The average stress ratio is defined as maximum stress minus minimum stress divided by maximum stress. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Metal alloy powder or particulate material, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.leadIn: Made from any of the following composition systems:
X in the following equals one or more alloying elements.

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Nickel alloys (Ni-Al-X, Ni-X-Al) qualified for turbine engine parts or components, i.e. with less than 3 non-metallic particles (introduced during the manufacturing process) larger than 100 μm in 109 alloy particles;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Niobium alloys (Nb-Al-X or Nb-X-Al, Nb-Si-X or Nb-X-Si, Nb-Ti-X or Nb-X-Ti);

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Titanium alloys (Ti-Al-X or Ti-X-Al);

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Aluminium alloys (Al-Mg-X or Al-X-Mg, Al-Zn-X or Al-X-Zn, Al-Fe-X or Al-X-Fe); or

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Magnesium alloys (Mg-Al-X or Mg-X-Al);

subparagraph.leadIn: Made in a controlled environment by any of the following processes:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Vacuum atomization”; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: “Gas atomization”; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: “Rotary atomization”; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: “Splat quenching”;

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: “Melt spinning” and “comminution”;

subparagraph.name: f
subparagraph.content: “Melt extraction” and “comminution”; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: g
subparagraph.content: “Mechanical alloying”; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: h
subparagraph.content: “Plasma atomization”; (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Capable of forming materials controlled by 1C002(a) or 1C002(b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Alloyed materials, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Made from any of the composition systems specified in 1C002(c)(1);
In the form of uncomminuted flakes, ribbons or thin rods; and

subparagraph.leadIn: Produced in a controlled environment by any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Splat quenching”;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: “Melt spinning”; or

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: “Melt extraction”; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: Magnetic metals, of all types and of whatever form, having any of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Initial relative permeability of 120 000 or more and a thickness of 0.05 mm or less;
Measurement of initial relative permeability must be performed on fully annealed materials. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Magnetostrictive alloys, having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content:
A saturation magnetostriction of more than
5 × 10-4; or
A magnetomechanical coupling factor (k) of more than 0.8; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Amorphous or ‘nanocrystalline’ alloy strips, having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: A composition having a minimum of 75 weight percent of iron, cobalt or nickel;
A saturation magnetic induction (Bs) of 1.6 T or more; and

subparagraph.leadIn: Any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A strip thickness of 0.02 mm or less; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: An electrical resistivity of 2 × 10-4 ohm cm or more;

paragraph.continued: ‘Nanocrystalline’ materials in 1C003(c) are those materials having a crystal grain size of 50 nm or less, as determined by X-ray diffraction.

subsection.leadIn: Uranium titanium alloys or tungsten alloys with a “matrix” based on iron, nickel or copper, having all of the following:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A density exceeding 17.5 g/cm3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: An elastic limit exceeding 880 MPa; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: An ultimate tensile strength exceeding 1 270 MPa; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: An elongation exceeding 8%;

subsection.leadIn: “Superconductive” “composite” conductors in lengths exceeding 100 m or with a mass exceeding 100 g, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: “Superconductive” “composite” conductors containing one or more niobium-titanium ‘filaments’, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Embedded in a “matrix” other than a copper or copper-based mixed “matrix”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: “Superconductive” “composite” conductors consisting of one or more “superconductive” ‘filaments’ other than niobium-titanium, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: A “critical temperature” at zero magnetic induction exceeding 9.85 K (-263.31°C);

Remaining in the “superconductive” state at a temperature of 4.2 K (-268.96°C) when exposed to a magnetic field oriented in any direction perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of conductor and corresponding to a magnetic induction of 12 T with critical current density exceeding 1 750 A/mm2 on overall cross-section of the conductor; and

paragraph.name: c

subsection.continued: For the purpose of 1C005, ‘filaments’ may be in wire, cylinder, film, tape or ribbon form.

subsection.leadIn: Fluids and lubricating materials, as follows:

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Lubricating materials containing, as their principal ingredients, phenylene, alkylphenylene ethers or thio-ethers, or their mixtures, containing more than two ether or thio-ether functions or their mixtures; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Damping or flotation fluids having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: Purity exceeding 99.8%;
Containing less than 25 particles of 200 μm or larger in size per 100 ml;

subparagraph.leadIn: Made from at least 85% of any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Dibromotetrafluoroethane (CAS 25497-30-7, 124-73-2, 27336-23-8);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Polychlorotrifluoroethylene (oily and waxy modifications only); or

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Polybromotrifluoroethylene; (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Fluorocarbon fluids designed for electronic cooling and having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: Containing 85% by weight or more of any of the following, or mixtures thereof:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Monomeric forms of perfluoropolyalkylether-triazines or perfluoroaliphatic-ethers;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Perfluoroalkylamines;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Perfluorocyclocalkanes; or

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Perfluoroalkanes;
Density at 298 K (25°C) of 1.5 g/ml or more;
In a liquid state at 273 K (0°C); and
Containing 60% or more by weight of fluorine;

subsection.continued: 1C006(d) does not apply to materials specified and packaged as medical products. (L.N. 89 of 2013)

subsection.leadIn: Ceramic powders, ceramic-“matrix” “composite” materials and ‘precursor materials’, as follows: (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021)
See also 1C107.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Ceramic powders of titanium diboride (TiB2) (CAS 12045-63-5) having total metallic impurities, excluding intentional additions, of less than 5 000 ppm, an average particle size equal to or less than 5 μm and no more than 10% of the particles larger than 10 μm; (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Ceramic-“matrix” “composite” materials as follows:

subparagraph.leadIn: Ceramic-ceramic “composite” materials with a glass or oxide-“matrix” and reinforced with any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.leadIn: Continuous fibres made from any of the following materials:

subparagraph.content: Si-C-N;

subparagraph.continued: 1C007(c)(1)(a) does not apply to “composites” containing fibres with a tensile strength of less than 700 MPa at 1 273 K (1 000°C) or tensile creep resistance of more than 1% creep strain at 100 MPa load and 1 273 K (1 000°C) for 100 hours.

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Fibres being all of the following:
Made from any of the following materials:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Si-N;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Si-C;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Si-Al-O-N;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Si-O-N;
Having a “specific tensile strength” exceeding 12.7 × 103 m;
Ceramic-“matrix” “composite” materials, with a “matrix” formed of carbides or nitrides of silicon, zirconium or boron; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: ‘Precursor materials’ specially designed for the “production” of the materials controlled by 1C007(c), as follows:

subparagraph.content: Polydiorganosilanes;
Polysilazanes;
Polycarbosilazanes; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.continued: For the purposes of 1C007, ‘precursor materials’ are special purpose polymeric or metallo-organic materials used for the “production” of silicon carbide, silicon nitride, or ceramics with silicon, carbon and nitrogen. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Non-fluorinated polymeric substances, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Imides as follows: (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.content: Bismaleimides; (L.N. 161 of 2011)
Aromatic polyamide-imides (PAI) having a ‘glass transition temperature (Tg)’ exceeding 563 K (290°C); (L.N. 161 of 2011)
Aromatic polyimides having a ‘glass transition temperature (Tg)’ exceeding 505 K (232°C); (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Aromatic polyetherimides having a ‘glass transition temperature (Tg)’ exceeding 563 K (290°C); (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.continued: 1C008(a) controls substances in liquid or solid “fusible” form, including resin, powder, pellet, film, sheet, tape or ribbon. (L.N. 226 of 2009; L.N. 42 of 2017)
For non-“fusible” aromatic polyimides in film, sheet, tape or ribbon form, see 1A003. (L.N. 226 of 2009)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Polyarylene ketones;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Polyarylene sulphides, where the arylene group is biphenylene, triphenylene or combinations thereof;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Polybiphenylenethersulphone having a ‘glass transition temperature (Tg)’ exceeding 563 K (290°C); (L.N. 89 of 2013)

The ‘glass transition temperature (Tg)’ for 1C008(a)(2) thermoplastic materials, 1C008(a)(4) materials and 1C008(f) materials is determined using the method described in ISO 11357/2 (1999) or national equivalents. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

The ‘glass transition temperature (Tg)’ for 1C008(a)(2) thermosetting materials and 1C008(a)(3) materials is determined using the 3-point bend method described in ASTM D 7028-07 or equivalent national standard. The test is to be performed using a dry test specimen that has attained a minimum of 90% degree of cure as defined by ASTM E 2160-04 or equivalent national standard, and was cured using the combination of standard and post-cure processes that yield the highest Tg. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Unprocessed fluorinated compounds, as follows:

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Fluorinated polyimides containing 10% by weight or more of combined fluorine;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Fluorinated phosphazene elastomers containing 30% by weight or more of combined fluorine;

subsection.leadIn: “Fibrous or filamentary materials” as follows:
See also 1C210 and 9C110. (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.content: In calculating the “specific modulus”, “specific tensile strength” or specific weight of “fibrous or filamentary materials” for the purposes of 1C010(a), 1C010(b), 1C010(c) or 1C010(e)(1)(b), the modulus or tensile strength is to be determined using Method A described in ISO 10618 (2004) or national equivalents.

The assessment of “specific modulus”, “specific tensile strength” or specific weight of non-unidirectional “fibrous or filamentary materials” (for example, fabrics, random mats or braids) under 1C010 is to be based on the mechanical properties of the constituent unidirectional monofilaments (for example, monofilaments, yarns, rovings or tows) prior to processing into the non-unidirectional “fibrous or filamentary materials”. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Organic “fibrous or filamentary materials”, having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: “Specific modulus” exceeding 12.7 × 106 m; and
“Specific tensile strength” exceeding 23.5 × 104 m;

paragraph.continued: 1C010(a) does not apply to polyethylene.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Carbon “fibrous or filamentary materials”, having all of the following:
1C010(b) does not apply to:

subparagraph.leadIn: “Fibrous or filamentary materials”, for the repair of “civil aircraft” structures or laminates, having all of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: An area not exceeding 1 m2;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: A length not exceeding 2.5 m; and

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: A width exceeding 15 mm.
Mechanically chopped, milled or cut carbon “fibrous or filamentary materials” 25.0 mm or less in length. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Inorganic “fibrous or filamentary materials”, having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: Either—

subparagraph.name: a
b
subparagraph.content: Not specified in 1C010(c)(1)(a) and having a “specific modulus” exceeding 5.6 × 106 m; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
Melting, softening, decomposition or sublimation point exceeding 1 922 K (1 649°C) in an inert environment;

paragraph.continued: 1C010(c) does not apply to:

subparagraph.content: Discontinuous, multiphase, polycrystalline alumina fibres in chopped fibre or random mat form, containing 3% by weight or more silica, with a “specific modulus” of less than 10 × 106 m. (L.N. 89 of 2021)
Molybdenum and molybdenum alloy fibres.
Boron fibres.
Discontinuous ceramic fibres with a melting, softening, decomposition or sublimation point lower than 2 043 K (1 770°C) in an inert environment.

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: “Fibrous or filamentary materials”:

subparagraph.leadIn: Composed of any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Polyetherimides specified by 1C008(a); or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Materials specified by 1C008(d), 1C008(e) and 1C008(f); or (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Composed of materials specified by 1C010(d)(1)(a) or 1C010(d)(1)(b) and “commingled” with other fibres specified by 1C010(a), 1C010(b) or 1C010(c); (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: Fully or partially resin-impregnated or pitch-impregnated “fibrous or filamentary materials” (prepregs), metal or carbon-coated “fibrous or filamentary materials” (preforms) or “carbon fibre preforms”, having all of the following:

subparagraph.leadIn: Any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Inorganic “fibrous or filamentary materials” specified by 1C010(c);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Organic or carbon “fibrous or filamentary materials”, having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: “Specific modulus” exceeding 10.15 × 106 m; and
“Specific tensile strength” exceeding 17.7 × 104 m; and

subparagraph.leadIn: Any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Resin or pitch specified by 1C008 or 1C009(b);

subparagraph.name: b
c
