subparagraph.leadIn: Total metallic impurities, excluding intentional additions, of less than:

subparagraph.content: 1 000 ppm for single oxides or carbides; or
5 000 ppm for complex compounds or single nitrides; and

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.leadIn: Being any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Zirconia (CAS 1314-23-4) with an average particle size equal to or less than 1 μm and no more than 10% of the particles larger than 5 μm; (L.N. 161 of 2011)
Other ceramic powders with an average particle size equal to or less than 5 μm and no more than 10% of the particles larger than 10 μm; (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Non-“composite” ceramic materials composed of the materials described in 1E002(c)(1);
1E002(c)(2) does not control “technology” for abrasives. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: “Technology” for the installation, maintenance or repair of materials controlled by 1C001;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: “Technology” for the repair of “composite” structures, laminates or materials controlled by 1A002 or 1C007(c); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

1E002(f) does not control “technology” for the repair of “civil aircraft” structures using carbon “fibrous or filamentary materials” and epoxy resins, contained in “aircraft” manufacturers’ manuals. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: g

subsection.content: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “use” of goods controlled by 1A102, 1B001, 1B101, 1B102, 1B115 to 1B119, 1C001, 1C101, 1C107, 1C111 to 1C118, 1D101 or 1D103;
“Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development” of “software” controlled by 1D001, 1D101 or 1D103;

“Technology” relating to the “production” of pyrolitically derived materials formed on a mould, mandrel or other substrate from precursor gases which decompose in the 1 573 K (1 300°C) to 3173 K (2 900°C) temperature range at pressures of 130 Pa to 20 kPa;
1E104 includes “technology” for the composition of precursor gases, flow-rates and process control schedules and parameters.

“Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “use” of goods specified in 1A002, 1A007, 1A202, 1A225 to 1A227, 1B201, 1B225 to 1B235, 1C002(b)(3) or (b)(4), 1C010(b), 1C202, 1C210, 1C216, 1C225 to 1C241 or 1D201;
“Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development” or “production” of goods specified in 1A007, 1A202 or 1A225 to 1A227;

section.name: s0
section.content: Systems, Equipment and Components
(For quiet running bearings, see the Munitions List)

subsection.leadIn: Anti-friction bearings and bearing systems, as follows, and components for such bearings and systems: (L.N. 42 of 2017)
See also 2A101. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Ball bearings and solid roller bearings having all tolerances specified by the manufacturer in accordance with ISO 492 Tolerance Class 4 or Class 2 (or national equivalents of these classes), or better, and having both ‘rings’ and ‘rolling elements’ made from monel or beryllium; (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 161 of 2011; L.N. 89 of 2021; L.N. 85 of 2023)
2A001(a) does not apply to tapered roller bearings. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.content: ‘Ring’—annular part of a radial rolling bearing incorporating one or more raceways (ISO 5593:1997).
‘Rolling element’—ball or roller that rolls between raceways (ISO 5593:1997). (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Active magnetic bearing systems using any of the following, and specially designed components for the systems: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Materials with flux densities of 2.0 T or greater and yield strengths greater than 414 MPa;
All-electromagnetic 3D homopolar bias designs for actuators; or
High temperature (450 K (177°C) and above) position sensors;

subsection.leadIn: Radial ball bearings, other than those specified in 2A001, having all tolerances specified in accordance with ISO 492 Tolerance Class 2 (or ANSI/ABMA Std 20 Tolerance Class ABEC-9 or other national equivalents), or better, and having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: An inner ring bore diameter between 12 mm and 50 mm;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: A width between 10 mm and 20 mm;

subsection.leadIn: Crucibles made of materials resistant to liquid actinide metals, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Crucibles having both of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: A volume of between 150 cm3 and 8 000 cm3; and

subparagraph.leadIn: Made of or coated with any of the following materials, or a combination of the following materials, having an overall impurity level of 2% or less by weight: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Calcium fluoride (CaF2);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Calcium zirconate (metazirconate) (CaZrO3);

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Cerium sulphide (Ce2S3);

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Erbium oxide (erbia) (Er2O3);

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Hafnium oxide (hafnia) (HfO2);

subparagraph.name: f
subparagraph.content: Magnesium oxide (MgO);

subparagraph.name: g
subparagraph.content: Nitrided niobium-titanium-tungsten alloy (approximately 50% Nb, 30% Ti, 20% W);

subparagraph.name: h
subparagraph.content: Yttrium oxide (yttria) (Y2O3); or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Zirconium oxide (zirconia) (ZrO2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Crucibles having both of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: A volume of between 50 cm3 and 2 000 cm3; and
Made of or lined with tantalum, having a purity of 99.9% or greater by weight;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Crucibles having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: A volume of between 50 cm3 and 2 000 cm3;
Made of or lined with tantalum, having a purity of 98% or greater by weight; and
Coated with tantalum carbide, nitride, boride, or any combination thereof;

subsection.leadIn: Valves having all of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A ‘nominal size’ of 5 mm or greater;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Having a bellows seal; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Wholly made of or lined with aluminium, aluminium alloy, nickel, or nickel alloy containing more than 60% nickel by weight;

subsection.continued: For valves with different inlet and outlet diameters, the ‘nominal size’ in 2A226 refers to the smallest diameter.

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: Test, Inspection and Production Equipment

paragraph.content: Secondary parallel contouring axes, (e.g. the w-axis on horizontal boring mills or a secondary rotary axis the centre line of which is parallel to the primary rotary axis) are not counted in the total number of contouring axes. Rotary axes need not rotate over 360°. A rotary axis can be driven by a linear device (e.g. a screw or a rack-and-pinion).

paragraph.leadIn: For the purposes of 2B, the number of axes which can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control” is the number of axes along or around which, during processing of a workpiece, simultaneous and interrelated motions are performed between the workpiece and a tool. This does not include any additional axes along or around which other relative motions within the machine are performed, such as:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Wheel-dressing systems in grinding machines;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Parallel rotary axes designed for mounting of separate workpieces;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Co-linear rotary axes designed for manipulating the same workpiece by holding it in a chuck from different ends. (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.content: Axis nomenclature shall be in accordance with International Standard ISO 841 (2001), Industrial automation systems and integration—Numerical control of machines—Coordinate system and motion nomenclature. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)
For the purposes of 2B001 to 2B009, a “tilting spindle” is counted as a rotary axis.

paragraph.leadIn: ‘Stated “unidirectional positioning repeatability”’ may be used for each machine tool model as an alternative to individual machine tests and is determined as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Select 5 machines of a model to be evaluated;

subparagraph.name: b
c
subparagraph.content:
Determine the arithmetic mean value of the “unidirectional positioning repeatability”-values for each axis of all the 5 machines together. These arithmetic mean values of “unidirectional positioning repeatability” (
UPR ¯
) become the stated value of each axis for the model (
UPR ¯¯¯¯¯¯
x ,
UPR ¯¯¯¯¯¯
y , …);

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Since the Category 2 list refers to each linear axis, there will be as many ‘stated “unidirectional positioning repeatability”’-values as there are linear axes; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: If any axis of a machine model not controlled by 2B001(a), 2B001(b) and 2B001(c) has a ‘stated “unidirectional positioning repeatability”’ equal to or less than the specified “unidirectional positioning repeatability” of each machine tool model plus 0.7 μm, the builder is to be required to reaffirm the accuracy level once every 18 months. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.content: For the purposes of 2B001(a), 2B001(b) and 2B001(c), measurement uncertainty for the “unidirectional positioning repeatability” of machine tools, as defined in ISO 230/2 (2014) or national equivalents, must not be considered. (L.N. 89 of 2013; L.N. 42 of 2017)

For the purposes of 2B001(a), 2B001(b) and 2B001(c), the measurement of axes is to be made according to the test procedures in paragraph 5.3.2 of ISO 230/2 (2014). Tests for axes longer than 2 m are to be made over 2 m segments. Axes longer than 4 m require multiple tests (for example, 2 tests for axes longer than 4 m and up to 8 m, 3 tests for axes longer than 8 m and up to 12 m), each over 2 m segments that are distributed in equal intervals over the axis length. Tests segments are equally spaced along the full axis length, with any excess length equally divided at the beginning, in between, and at the end of the test segments. The smallest “unidirectional positioning repeatability”-value of all test segments is to be reported. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Machine tools and any combination of machine tools, for removing or cutting metals, ceramics or “composites”, which, according to the manufacturer’s technical specification, can be equipped with electronic devices for “numerical control”, as follows: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.content: 2B001 does not control special purpose machine tools limited to the manufacture of gears. For such machines, see 2B003.

paragraph.leadIn: 2B001 does not control special purpose machine tools limited to the manufacture of any of the following parts:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Crank shafts or cam shafts;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Tools or cutters;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Extruder worms;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Engraved or facetted jewellery parts; (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Dental prostheses. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.content: A machine tool having at least two of the three turning, milling or grinding capabilities (e.g. a turning machine with milling capability), must be evaluated against each applicable entry of 2B001(a), (b) or (c). (L.N. 65 of 2004; E.R. 6 of 2020; L.N. 85 of 2023)

A machine tool having an additive manufacturing capability in addition to a turning, milling or grinding capability must be evaluated against each applicable entry of 2B001(a), (b) or (c). (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: See also 2B201. For optical finishing machines, see 2B002. (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Machine tools for turning having 2 or more axes that can be co-ordinated simultaneously for “contouring control” having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.leadIn: 2B001(a) does not include turning machines specially designed for producing contact lenses, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Machine controller limited to using ophthalmic based software for part programming data input;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: No vacuum chucking.

2B001(a) does not control bar machines (Swissturn), limited to machining only bar feed thru, if maximum bar diameter is equal to or less than 42 mm and there is no capability of mounting chucks. Machines may have drilling or milling capabilities for machining parts with diameters less than 42 mm. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Machine tools for milling, having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.leadIn: Three linear axes plus 1 rotary axis which can be co-ordinated simultaneously for “contouring control” having any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Unidirectional positioning repeatability” equal to or less (better) than 0.9 μm along one or more linear axis with a travel length less than 1.0 m;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: “Unidirectional positioning repeatability” equal to or less (better) than 1.1 μm along one or more linear axis with a travel length equal to or greater than 1.0 m; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.leadIn: Five or more axes which can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control” and that meet any of the following descriptions: (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Unidirectional positioning repeatability” equal to or less (better) than 0.9 μm along one or more linear axes with a travel length less than 1 m; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: b
c

subparagraph.content: A “unidirectional positioning repeatability” for jig boring machines, equal to or less (better) than 1.1 μm along one or more linear axes; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.leadIn: Fly cutting machines, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Spindle “run out” and “camming” less (better) than 0.0004 mm TIR; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Angular deviation of slide movement (yaw, pitch and roll) less (better) than 2 seconds of arc, TIR, over 300 mm of travel; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Machine tools for grinding, having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.leadIn: Having all of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Unidirectional positioning repeatability” equal to or less (better) than 1.1 μm along one or more linear axes; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Three or four axes which can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”; or (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.leadIn: Five or more axes which can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control” and that meet any of the following descriptions: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: a
b
c

paragraph.continued: 2B001(c) does not control grinding machines, as follows:

subparagraph.leadIn: Cylindrical external, internal, and external-internal grinding machines having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Limited to cylindrical grinding; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Limited to a maximum workpiece capacity of 150 mm outside diameter or length.
Machines designed specifically as jig grinders that do not have a z-axis or a w-axis, with a “unidirectional positioning repeatability” less (better) than 1.1 μm. (L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 89 of 2013)
Surface grinders. (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: Machine tools for removing metals, ceramics or “composites”, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.leadIn: Removing material by means of any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Water or other liquid jets, including those employing abrasive additives;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Electron beam; or

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: “Laser” beam; and

subparagraph.leadIn: At least two rotary axes having all of the following: (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”; and

subparagraph.name: b

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Deep-hole-drilling machines and turning machines modified for deep-hole-drilling, having a maximum depth-of-bore capability exceeding 5 m;

subsection.leadIn: Numerically controlled optical finishing machine tools equipped for selective material removal to produce non-spherical optical surfaces having all of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Finishing the form to less (better) than 1.0 μm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Finishing to a roughness less (better) than 100 nm rms;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Four or more axes which can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Using any of the following processes:

subparagraph.content: ‘Magnetorheological finishing (MRF)’;
‘Electrorheological finishing (ERF)’;
‘Energetic particle beam finishing’;
‘Inflatable membrane tool finishing’;
‘Fluid jet finishing’;

subsection.continued: For the purposes of 2B002:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ‘MRF’ is a material removal process using an abrasive magnetic fluid whose viscosity is controlled by a magnetic field;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ‘ERF’ is a removal process using an abrasive fluid whose viscosity is controlled by an electric field;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ‘Energetic particle beam finishing’ uses Reactive Atom Plasmas (RAP) or ion-beams to selectively remove material;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: ‘Fluid jet finishing’ makes use of a fluid stream for material removal.

subsection.leadIn: “Numerically controlled” machine tools, specially designed for the shaving, finishing, grinding or honing of hardened (Rc = 40 or more) spur, helical and double-helical gears having all of the following:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A pitch diameter exceeding 1 250 mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: A face width of 15% of pitch diameter or larger;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: A finished quality of AGMA 14 or better (equivalent to ISO 1328 class 3);

subsection.leadIn: Hot “isostatic presses”, having all of the following, and specially designed components and accessories therefor: (L.N. 132 of 2001)
See also 2B104 and 2B204.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A controlled thermal environment within the closed cavity and a chamber cavity with an inside diameter of 406 mm or more; and (L.N. 183 of 1999)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Any of the following:

subparagraph.content: A maximum working pressure exceeding 207 MPa;
A controlled thermal environment exceeding 1 773 K (1 500°C); or
A facility for hydrocarbon impregnation and removal of resultant gaseous degradation products;

subsection.continued: The inside chamber dimension is that of the chamber in which both the working temperature and the working pressure are achieved and does not include fixtures. That dimension will be the smaller of either the inside diameter of the pressure chamber or the inside diameter of the insulated furnace chamber, depending on which of the two chambers is located inside the other.
For specially designed dies, moulds and tooling see 1B003, 9B009 and ML18 of the Munitions List. (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: Equipment specially designed for the deposition, processing and in-process control of inorganic overlays, coatings and surface modifications, as follows, for substrates specified in column 2 of the Table, by processes specified in column 1 of the Table following 2E003(f), and specially designed automated handling, positioning, manipulation and control components therefor: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Chemical vapour deposition (CVD) production equipment having all of the following:
paragraph.continued: See also 2B105. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.leadIn: Process modified for one of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Pulsating CVD;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Controlled nucleation thermal deposition (CNTD); or (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Plasma enhanced or plasma assisted CVD; and

subparagraph.leadIn: Any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Incorporating high vacuum (equal to or less than 0.01 Pa) rotating seals; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Incorporating in situ coating thickness control; (E.R. 6 of 2020)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Ion implantation production equipment having beam currents of 5 mA or more;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Electron beam physical vapour deposition (EB-PVD) production equipment incorporating power systems rated for over 80 kW, having any of the following:

subparagraph.content: A liquid pool level “laser” control system which regulates precisely the ingots feed rate; or

A computer controlled rate monitor operating on the principle of photo-luminescence of the ionized atoms in the evaporant stream to control the deposition rate of a coating containing two or more elements; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Plasma spraying production equipment having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Operating at reduced pressure controlled atmosphere (equal to or less than 10 kPa measured above and within 300 mm of the gun nozzle exit) in a vacuum chamber capable of evacuation down to 0.01 Pa prior to the spraying process; or
Incorporating in situ coating thickness control; (E.R. 6 of 2020)

paragraph.name: e
f
g
paragraph.leadIn: Ion plating production equipment capable of in situ measurement of any of the following: (L.N. 161 of 2011; E.R. 6 of 2020)

subparagraph.content: Coating thickness on the substrate and rate control; or
Optical characteristics;

paragraph.continued: 2B005(a), 2B005(b), 2B005(e), 2B005(f) and 2B005(g) do not control chemical vapour deposition, cathodic arc, sputter deposition, ion plating or ion implantation equipment specially designed for cutting or machining tools.

subsection.leadIn: Dimensional inspection or measuring systems, equipment, position feedback units and “electronic assemblies”, as follows: (L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Computer controlled or “numerical controlled” Coordinate Measuring Machines (CMM), having a three dimensional (volumetric) maximum permissible error of length measurement (E0,MPE) at any point within the operating range of the machine (i.e. within the length of axes) equal to or less (better) than 1.7 + L/1 000 μm (L is the measured length in mm), according to ISO 10360-2 (2009); (L.N. 85 of 2023)
See also 2B206.

The E0,MPE of the most accurate configuration of the CMM specified by the manufacturer (e.g. best of the following: probe, stylus length, motion parameters, environment) and with “all compensations available” is to be compared to the 1.7 + L/1 000 μm threshold. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Linear displacement measuring instruments or systems, linear position feedback units, and “electronic assemblies”, as follows:
paragraph.continued: Interferometer and optical-encoder measuring systems containing a “laser” are only specified in 2B006(b)(3) and 2B206(c).

subparagraph.leadIn: ‘Non-contact type measuring systems’ with a ‘resolution’ equal to or less (better) than 0.2 μm within 0 to 0.2 mm of the ‘measuring range’; (L.N. 6 of 2025)

paragraph.content: For the purposes of 2B006(b)(1), ‘non-contact type measuring systems’ are designed to measure the distance between the probe and measured object along a single vector, where the probe or measured object is in motion.
For the purposes of 2B006(b)(1), ‘measuring range’ means the distance between the minimum and maximum working distance. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: Measuring systems having all of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Containing a “laser”;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: A ‘resolution’ over their full scale of 0.200 nm or less (better); (L.N. 85 of 2023; L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Capable of achieving a “measurement uncertainty” equal to or less (better) than (1.6 + L/2 000) nm (L is the measured length in mm) at any point within a measuring range, when compensated for the refractive index of air and measured over a period of 30 seconds at a temperature of 20±0.01°C; or
“Electronic assemblies” specially designed to provide feedback capability in systems specified in 2B006(b)(3); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.continued: For the purpose of 2B006(b), ‘resolution’ is the least increment of a measuring device; on digital instruments, the least significant bit. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 2B006(c) does not control optical instruments, such as autocollimators, using collimated light (e.g. “laser” light) to detect angular displacement of a mirror. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Equipment for measuring surface roughness (including surface defects), by measuring optical scatter with a sensitivity of 0.5 nm or less (better); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.continued: 2B006 includes machine tools, other than those specified by 2B001, that can be used as measuring machines if they meet or exceed the criteria specified for the measuring machine function. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: “Robots” having any of the following characteristics and specially designed controllers and “end-effectors” therefor:
See also 2B207.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Specially designed to comply with national safety standards applicable to potentially explosive munitions environments;
2B007(b) does not include “robots” specially designed for paint-spraying booths. (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Specially designed or rated as radiation-hardened to withstand greater than 5 × 103 Gy (silicon) without operational degradation; or (L.N. 85 of 2023)
The term Gy (silicon) refers to the energy in Joules per kilogram absorbed by an unshielded silicon sample when exposed to ionising radiation. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Specially designed to operate at altitudes exceeding 30 000 m;

subsection.leadIn: “Compound rotary tables” and “tilting spindles”, specially designed for machine tools, as follows: (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: “Compound rotary tables” having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: Designed for machine tools for turning, milling or grinding;
Two rotary axes designed to be co-ordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: “Tilting spindles” having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: Designed for machine tools for turning, milling or grinding;
Designed to be co-ordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Spin-forming machines and flow-forming machines, which, according to the manufacturer’s technical specification, can be equipped with “numerical control” units or a computer control and having all of the following:
See also 2B109 and 2B209.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 3 or more axes that can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”; (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: A roller force more than 60 kN;

subsection.continued: Machines combining the function of spin-forming and flow-forming are for the purpose of 2B009 regarded as flow-forming machines.

subsection.leadIn: “Isostatic presses”, other than those controlled by 2B004, having all of the following: (L.N. 95 of 2006)
See also 2B204.

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: Designed to achieve and maintain a controlled thermal environment of 873 K (600°C) or greater; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Possessing a chamber cavity with an inside diameter of 254 mm or greater; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subsection.content: Chemical vapour deposition (CVD) furnaces, other than those controlled by 2B005(a), designed or modified for the densification of carbon-carbon composites;

subsection.leadIn: Flow-forming machines, other than those controlled by 2B009, usable in the “production” of propulsion components and equipment (e.g. motor cases and interstages) for “missiles”, and specially designed components as follows: (L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 89 of 2021)
See also 2B209.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Flow-forming machines having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: Equipped with or, according to the manufacturer’s technical specification, are capable of being equipped with “numerical control” units or computer control; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
With more than two axes which can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Specially designed components for flow-forming machines controlled by 2B009 or 2B109(a); (L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.continued: Machines combining the function of spin-forming and flow-forming are for the purpose of 2B109 regarded as flow-forming machines. (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: Vibration test systems, equipment and components therefor, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Vibration test systems employing feedback or closed loop techniques and incorporating a digital controller, capable of vibrating a system at an acceleration equal to or greater than 10 g rms between 20 Hz and 2 kHz while imparting forces equal to or greater than 50 kN, measured ‘bare table’; (L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Digital controllers, combined with specially designed vibration test software, with a ‘real time control bandwidth’ greater than 5 kHz designed for use with vibration test systems controlled by 2B116(a); (L.N. 226 of 2009)

In 2B116(b), the term ‘real time control bandwidth’ means the maximum rate at which a controller can execute complete cycles of sampling, processing data and transmitting control signals. (L.N. 226 of 2009; L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Vibration thrusters (shaker units), with or without associated amplifiers, capable of imparting a force equal to or greater than 50 kN, measured ‘bare table’ and usable in vibration test systems controlled by 2B116(a);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Test piece support structures and electronic units designed to combine multiple shaker units in a system capable of providing an effective combined force equal to or greater than 50 kN, measured ‘bare table’, and usable in vibration systems controlled by 2B116(a); (L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.continued: In 2B116, ‘bare table’ means a flat table, or surface, with no fixture or fittings.

subsection.leadIn: Balancing machines and related equipment, as follows:
See also 2B219.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Balancing machines having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Not capable of balancing rotors/assemblies having a mass greater than 3 kg;
Capable of balancing rotors/assemblies at speeds greater than 12 500 rpm;
Capable of correcting unbalance in two planes or more; and
Capable of balancing to a residual specific unbalance of 0.2 g mm per kg of rotor mass;

paragraph.continued: 2B119(a) does not control balancing machines designed or modified for dental or other medical equipment.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Indicator heads designed or modified for use with machines controlled by 2B119(a); (L.N. 95 of 2006)
Indicator heads are sometimes known as balancing instrumentation.

subsection.leadIn: Motion simulators or rate tables having all of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Two axes or more;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Designed or modified to incorporate slip rings or integrated non-contact devices capable of transferring electrical power or signal information, or both; (L.N. 226 of 2009)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.leadIn: For any single axis having both of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Capable of rates of 400 degrees/s or more, or 30 degrees/s or less; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: A rate resolution equal to or less than 6 degrees/s and an accuracy equal to or less than 0.6 degrees/s;
A positioning “accuracy” equal to or less (better) than 5 arc second; (L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.content: 2B120 does not include rotary tables designed or modified for machine tools or for medical equipment. For controls on machine tool rotary tables, see 2B008.
Motion simulators or rate tables specified in 2B120 remain controlled whether or not slip rings or integrated non-contact devices are fitted at time of export. (L.N. 226 of 2009; L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Positioning tables (equipment capable of precise rotary positioning in any axes), other than those controlled by 2B120, having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Two axes or more; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: A positioning “accuracy” equal to or less (better) than 5 arc second; (L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.continued: 2B121 does not control rotary tables designed or modified for machine tools or for medical equipment. For controls on machine tool rotary tables, see 2B008.

subsection.content: Centrifuges specified in 2B122 remain controlled whether or not slip rings or integrated non-contact devices are fitted at time of export. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Machine tools and any combination of machine tools, other than those controlled by 2B001, as follows, for removing or cutting metals, ceramics or “composites”, which, according to the manufacturer’s technical specification, can be equipped with electronic devices for simultaneous “contouring control” in two or more axes: (L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 42 of 2017)

continued.leadIn: Stated positioning accuracy levels derived under the following procedures from measurements made according to ISO 230/2 (1988) or national equivalents may be used for each machine tool model if provided to, and accepted by, national authorities instead of individual machine tests. Stated positioning accuracy is determined as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Select 5 machines of a model to be evaluated;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Measure the linear axis accuracies according to ISO 230/2 (1988);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content:
Determine the accuracy
values (A) for each axis of each machine. The method of calculating the accuracy value is described in ISO 230/2 (1988) standard;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Determine the average accuracy value for each axis. This average value becomes the stated positioning accuracy of each axis for the model (Âx, Ây, ...);

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.leadIn: If any axis of a machine tool not controlled by 2B201(a), 2B201(b) or 2B201(c) has the following stated positioning accuracy according to ISO 230/2 (1988), then the builder is to be required to reaffirm the accuracy level once every 18 months— (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: for grinding machines—equal to or less (better) than 6 μm; or
for milling and turning machines—equal to or less (better) than 8 μm. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Machine tools for milling, having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Positioning accuracies with “all compensations available” equal to or less (better) than 6 μm according to ISO 230/2 (1988) or national equivalents along any linear axis; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Two or more contouring rotary axes;
Five or more axes which can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.continued: 2B201(a) does not control milling machines having the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: X-axis travel greater than 2 m; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Overall positioning accuracy on the x-axis more (worse) than 30 μm. (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Machine tools for grinding, having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Positioning accuracies with “all compensations available” equal to or less (better) than 4 μm according to ISO 230/2 (1988) or national equivalents along any linear axis; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Two or more contouring rotary axes; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Five or more axes, which can be coordinated simultaneously for “contouring control”; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

continued.leadIn: 2B201(b) does not control the following grinding machines: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.leadIn: Cylindrical external, internal, and external-internal grinding machines having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Limited to a maximum workpiece capacity of 150 mm outside diameter or length;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Axes limited to x, z and c; and
Jig grinders that do not have a z-axis or a w-axis with an overall positioning accuracy less (better) than 4 μm according to ISO 230/2 (1988) or national equivalents. (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Machine tools for turning, having positioning accuracies with “all compensations available” better (less) than 6 μm according to ISO 230/2 (1988) along any linear axis (overall positioning) for machines capable of machining parts with diameters greater than 35 mm;

content.leadIn: 2B201(c) does not control bar machines (Swissturn) having the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Only for machining bar feed thru;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: The maximum bar diameter is equal to or less than 42 mm; and

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: No capability of mounting chucks,

content.continued: though such machines described above may have drilling or milling capabilities, or both, for machining parts with diameters less than 42 mm. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.leadIn: 2B201 does not control special purpose machine tools limited to the manufacture of any of the following parts:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Gears;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Crankshafts or camshafts;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Tools or cutters;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Extruder worms. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.content: A machine tool having at least two of the three turning, milling or grinding capabilities (e.g. a turning machine with milling capability), must be evaluated against each applicable entry of 2B201(a), 2B201(b) or 2B201(c). (L.N. 254 of 2008; E.R. 6 of 2020)
2B201(a)(3) and 2B201(b)(3) include machines based on a parallel linear kinematic design (e.g. hexapods) that have 5 or more axes none of which is a rotary axis. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: “Isostatic presses”, other than those controlled by 2B004 or 2B104, and related equipment, as follows: (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: “Isostatic presses” having both of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Capable of achieving a maximum working pressure of 69 MPa or greater; and
A chamber cavity with an inside diameter in excess of 152 mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Dies, moulds and controls, specially designed for “isostatic presses” controlled by 2B204(a); (L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.continued: In 2B204, the inside chamber dimension is that of the chamber in which both the working temperature and the working pressure are achieved and does not include fixtures. That dimension will be the smaller of either the inside diameter of the pressure chamber or the inside diameter of the insulated furnace chamber, depending on which of the two chambers is located inside the other. (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: Dimensional inspection machines, instruments or systems, other than those specified in 2B006, as follows: (L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Computer controlled or numerically controlled coordinate measuring machines (CMM) meeting either of the following descriptions: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: Having only 2 axes and having a maximum permissible error of length measurement along any axis (1-dimensional), identified as any combination of E0x,MPE, E0y,MPE, or E0z,MPE, equal to or less (better) than (1.25 + L/1000) μm (where L is the measured length in mm) at any point within the operating range of the machine (i.e. within the length of the axis), according to ISO 10360/2 (2009);

Having 3 or more axes and having a 3-dimensional (volumetric) maximum permissible error of length measurement (E0,MPE) equal to or less (better) than (1.7 + L/800) μm (where L is the measured length in mm) at any point within the operating range of the machine (i.e. within the length of the axis), according to ISO 10360/2 (2009);

paragraph.continued: The E0,MPE of the most accurate configuration of the CMM specified according to ISO 10360/2 (2009) by the manufacturer (e.g. best of the following: probe, stylus, length, motion parameters, environments) and with all compensations available is to be compared to the (1.7 + L/800) μm threshold. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Systems for simultaneously linear-angular inspection of hemishells, having both of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: “Measurement uncertainty” along any linear axis equal to or less (better) than 3.5 μm per 5 mm; and
“Angular position deviation” equal to or less than 0.02°;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: ‘Linear displacement’ measuring systems having all of the following characteristics:
For the purposes of 2B206(c), ‘linear displacement’ means the change of distance between the measuring probe and the measured object.

subparagraph.content: Containing a “laser”;

subparagraph.leadIn: Capable of maintaining, for at least 12 hours, over a temperature range of ±1 K (±1°C); around a standard temperature and standard pressure, all of the following: (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A ‘resolution’ over their full scale of 0.1 μm or better; (L.N. 85 of 2023; L.N. 6 of 2025)Technical Note:For the purpose of 2B206(c)(2)(a), ‘resolution’ is the least increment of a measuring device; on digital instruments, the least significant bit. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: With a “measurement uncertainty” equal to or less (better) than (0.2 + L/2 000) μm (L is the measured length in mm);

paragraph.continued: 2B206(c) does not control measuring interferometer systems, without closed or open loop feedback, containing a laser to measure slide movement errors of machine tools, dimensional inspection machines, or similar equipment. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Linear variable differential transformer (LVDT) systems having both of the following characteristics:
For the purposes of 2B206(d), ‘linear displacement’ means the change of distance between the measuring probe and the measured object. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: Having any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
b

subparagraph.content: Drift equal to or less (better) than 0.1% per day at a standard ambient test room temperature ±1 K (±1°C); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.content: Machine tools that can be used as measuring machines are controlled if they meet or exceed the criteria specified for the machine tool function or the measuring machine function.
A machine specified in 2B206 is controlled if it exceeds the control threshold anywhere within its operating range.

subsection.continued: All parameters of measurement values in 2B206 represent plus/minus i.e. not total band. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: “Robots”, “end-effectors” and control units, other than those controlled by 2B007, as follows: (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: Control units specially designed for any of the “robots” or “end-effectors” controlled by 2B207(a); (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Flow forming machines, spin forming machines capable of flow forming functions, other than those controlled by 2B009 or 2B109, and mandrels, as follows: (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Machines having both of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Three or more rollers (active or guiding); and
Which, according to the manufacturer’s technical specification, can be equipped with “numerical control” units or a computer control; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Rotor-forming mandrels designed to form cylindrical rotors of inside diameter between 75 mm and 650 mm; (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subsection.continued: 2B209(a) includes machines which have only a single roller designed to deform metal plus two auxiliary rollers which support the mandrel, but do not participate directly in the deformation process. (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: Centrifugal multiplane balancing machines, fixed or portable, horizontal or vertical, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Centrifugal balancing machines designed for balancing flexible rotors having a length of 600 mm or more and having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Swing or journal diameter greater than 75 mm; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Mass capability of from 0.9 to 23 kg; and
Capable of balancing speed of revolution more than 5 000 rpm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Centrifugal balancing machines designed for balancing hollow cylindrical rotor components and having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Journal diameter greater than 75 mm; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Mass capability of from 0.9 to 23 kg;
A minimum achievable residual specific unbalance equal to or less than 10 g mm/kg per plane; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
Belt drive type; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: Remote manipulators that can be used to provide remote actions in radiochemical separation operations or hot cells, as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Having a capability of penetrating 0.6 m or more of hot cell wall (through-the-wall operation); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Having a capability of bridging over the top of a hot cell wall with a thickness of 0.6 m or more (over-the-wall operation);

subsection.continued: Remote manipulators provide translation of human operator actions to a remote operating arm and terminal fixture. They may be of master/slave type or operated by joystick or keypad.

subsection.leadIn: Controlled atmosphere (vacuum or inert gas) induction furnaces, other than those controlled by 3B001 and 9B001 and power supplies therefor, as follows: (L.N. 89 of 2021)
See also 3B001 and 9B001. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Furnaces having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Capable of operation above 1 123 K (850°C);
Induction coils 600 mm or less in diameter; and
Designed for power inputs of 5 kW or more;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Power supplies, with a specified power output of 5 kW or more, specially designed for furnaces controlled by 2B226(a); (L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.continued: 2B226(a) does not control furnaces designed for the processing of semiconductor wafers.

subsection.leadIn: Vacuum or other controlled atmosphere metallurgical melting and casting furnaces and related equipment as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Arc remelt furnaces, arc melt furnaces and arc melt and casting furnaces having both of the following characteristics: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: Consumable electrode capacities between 1 000 cm3 and 20 000 cm3; and
Capable of operating with melting temperatures above 1 973 K (1 700°C);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Electron beam melting furnaces, “plasma atomization” furnaces and plasma melting furnaces, having both of the following characteristics: (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: A power of 50 kW or greater; and
Capable of operating with melting temperatures above 1 473 K (1 200°C);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Computer control and monitoring systems specially configured for any of the furnaces controlled by 2B227(a) or 2B227(b); (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Plasma torches specially designed for furnaces controlled by 2B227(b) having both of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Operating at a power greater than 50 kW;
Capable of operating above 1 473 K (1 200°C); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Electron beam guns specially designed for furnaces controlled by 2B227(b) operating at a power greater than 50 kW; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Rotor fabrication or assembly equipment, rotor straightening equipment, bellows-forming mandrels and dies, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Rotor assembly equipment for assembly of gas centrifuge rotor tube sections, baffles, and end caps;
2B228(a) includes precision mandrels, clamps, and shrink fit machines.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Rotor straightening equipment for alignment of gas centrifuge rotor tube sections to a common axis;

In 2B228(b), such equipment normally consists of precision measuring probes linked to a computer that subsequently controls the action of, for example, pneumatic rams used for aligning the rotor tube sections.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Bellows-forming mandrels and dies for producing single-convolution bellows;
In 2B228(c), the bellows have all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Inside diameter between 75 mm and 650 mm; (L.N. 6 of 2025)
Length equal to or greater than 12.7 mm;
Single convolution depth greater than 2 mm; and
Made of high-strength aluminium alloys, maraging steel or high strength “fibrous or filamentary materials”.

subsection.leadIn: All types of ‘pressure transducers’ capable of measuring absolute pressures that meet all of the following descriptions: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Pressure sensing elements made of or protected by aluminium, aluminium alloy, aluminium oxide (alumina or sapphire), nickel or nickel alloy with more than 60% nickel by weight, or fully fluorinated hydrocarbon polymers; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Seals, if any, essential for sealing the pressure sensing element, and in direct contact with the process medium, made of or protected by aluminium, aluminium alloy, aluminium oxide (alumina or sapphire), nickel or nickel alloy with more than 60% nickel by weight, or fully fluorinated hydrocarbon polymers; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Having either of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: A full scale of 13 kPa or greater and an ‘accuracy’ of better than 130 Pa when measured at 13 kPa; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.content: In 2B230, ‘pressure transducer’ means a device that converts a pressure measurement into a signal.
For the purposes of 2B230, ‘accuracy’ includes non-linearity, hysteresis and repeatability at ambient temperature. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Vacuum pumps having all of the following characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Input throat size equal to or greater than 380 mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Pumping speed equal to or greater than 15 m3/s; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Capable of producing an ultimate vacuum better than 13 mPa;
The pumping speed is determined at the measurement point with nitrogen gas or air.
The ultimate vacuum is determined at the input of the pump with the input of the pump blocked off.

subsection.content:
N.B.:
See also the Munitions List.

subsection.leadIn: Bellows-sealed scroll-type compressors and bellows-sealed scroll-type vacuum pumps that meet all of the following descriptions:
See also 2B350(i).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Capable of an inlet volume flow rate of 50 m3/h or greater;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Capable of a pressure ratio of 2:1 or greater;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Having all surfaces that come in contact with the process gas made from any of the following materials:

subparagraph.content: Aluminium or aluminium alloy;
Aluminium oxide;
Stainless steel;
Nickel or nickel alloy;
Phosphor bronze;
Fluoropolymers;

subsection.leadIn: Chemical manufacturing facilities, equipment and components, as follows: (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Reaction vessels or reactors, with or without agitators, with total internal (geometric) volume greater than 0.1 m3 (100 litres) and less than 20 m3 (20 000 litres), where all surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed or contained are made from any of the following materials:
paragraph.continued: For prefabricated repair assemblies, see 2B350(k). (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;
Fluoropolymers (polymeric or elastomeric materials with more than 35% fluorine by weight);
Glass (including vitrified or enamelled coating or glass lining);
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;
Tantalum or tantalum ‘alloys’;
Titanium or titanium ‘alloys’;
Zirconium or zirconium ‘alloys’;
Niobium (columbium) or niobium ‘alloys’; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Agitators designed for use in reaction vessels or reactors specified in 2B350(a); and impellers, blades or shafts designed for such agitators, where all surfaces of the agitator that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed or contained are made from any of the following materials: (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;
Fluoropolymers (polymeric or elastomeric materials with more than 35% fluorine by weight);
Glass (including vitrified or enamelled coatings or glass lining);
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;
Tantalum or tantalum ‘alloys’;
Titanium or titanium ‘alloys’;
Zirconium or zirconium ‘alloys’;
Niobium (columbium) or niobium ‘alloys’; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Storage tanks, containers or receivers with a total internal (geometric) volume greater than 0.1 m3 (100 litres) where all surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed or contained are made from any of the following materials:
paragraph.continued: For prefabricated repair assemblies, see 2B350(k). (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;
Fluoropolymers (polymeric or elastomeric materials with more than 35% fluorine by weight);
Glass (including vitrified or enamelled coatings or glass lining);
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;
Tantalum or tantalum ‘alloys’;
Titanium or titanium ‘alloys’;
Zirconium or zirconium ‘alloys’;
Niobium (columbium) or niobium ‘alloys’; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Heat exchangers or condensers with a heat transfer surface area greater than 0.15 m2, and less than 20 m2; and tubes, plates, coils or blocks (cores) designed for such heat exchangers or condensers, where all surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed are made from any of the following materials: (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;
Fluoropolymers (polymeric or elastomeric materials with more than 35% fluorine by weight);
Glass (including vitrified or enamelled coatings or glass lining);
Graphite or ‘carbon graphite’; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;
Tantalum or tantalum ‘alloys’;
Titanium or titanium ‘alloys’; (L.N. 132 of 2001)
Zirconium or zirconium ‘alloys’;
Silicon carbide; (L.N. 132 of 2001)
Titanium carbide; (L.N. 132 of 2001)
Niobium (columbium) or niobium ‘alloys’; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: Distillation or absorption columns of internal diameter greater than 0.1 m; and liquid distributers, vapour distributers or liquid collectors designed for such distillation or absorption columns, where all surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed are made from any of the following materials: (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;
Fluoropolymers (polymeric or elastomeric materials with more than 35% fluorine by weight);
Glass (including vitrified or enamelled coatings or glass lining);
Graphite or ‘carbon graphite’; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;
Tantalum or tantalum ‘alloys’;
Titanium or titanium ‘alloys’;
Zirconium or zirconium ‘alloys’;
Niobium (columbium) or niobium ‘alloys’; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: Remotely operated filling equipment in which all surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed are made from any of the following materials:

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight; or
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: Valves and components, as follows:

subparagraph.leadIn: Valves that meet all of the following descriptions:

subparagraph.name: a
b

subparagraph.leadIn: Valves, other than those specified in 2B350(g)(1), that meet all of the following descriptions:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A ‘nominal size’ equal to or greater than DN 25 or NPS 1 and equal to or less than DN 100 or NPS 4; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Casings (valve bodies) or preformed casing liners;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: A closure element designed to be interchangeable;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: All surfaces of the casing (valve body) or preformed case liner that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being produced, processed, or contained are made from ‘corrosion resistant materials’; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: Components, designed for valves specified in 2B350(g)(1) or 2B350(g)(2), in which all surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being produced, processed, or contained are made from ‘corrosion resistant materials’, as follows:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Casings (valve bodies);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Preformed casing liners;

subparagraph.leadIn: For the purposes of 2B350(g), ‘corrosion resistant materials’ mean any of the following materials:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Fluoropolymers (polymeric or elastomeric materials with more than 35% fluorine by weight);

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Glass or glass-lined (including vitrified or enamelled coating);

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Tantalum or tantalum alloys; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: f
subparagraph.content: Titanium or titanium alloys; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: g
subparagraph.content: Zirconium or zirconium alloys; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: h
subparagraph.content: Niobium (columbium) or niobium alloys; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: Ceramic materials as follows:

subparagraph.content: Silicon carbide with a purity of 80% or more by weight;
Aluminium oxide (alumina) with a purity of 99.9% or more by weight;
Zirconium oxide (zirconia).
‘Nominal size’ is defined as the smaller of the inlet and outlet diameters. (L.N. 42 of 2017)
Nominal sizes (DN) of valves are in accordance with ISO 6708:1995. Nominal Pipe Sizes (NPS) are in accordance with ASME B36.10 or B36.19 or national equivalents. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: Multi-walled piping incorporating a leak detection port, in which all surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed or contained are made from any of the following materials:

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;
Fluoropolymers (polymeric or elastomeric materials with more than 35% fluorine by weight);
Glass (including vitrified or enamelled coatings or glass lining);
Graphite or ‘carbon graphite’; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;
Tantalum or tantalum ‘alloys’;
Titanium or titanium ‘alloys’;
Zirconium or zirconium ‘alloys’;
Niobium (columbium) or niobium ‘alloys’; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: Multiple-seal and seal-less pumps, with manufacturer’s specified maximum flow-rate greater than 0.6 m3/hour, or vacuum pumps with manufacturer’s specified maximum flow-rate greater than 5 m3/hour (under standard temperature (273 K (0°C)) and pressure (101.3 kPa) conditions, other than those specified in 2B233); and casings (pump bodies), preformed casing liners, impellers, rotors or jet pump nozzles designed for such pumps, in which all surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed are made from any of the following materials: (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;
Ceramics;
Fluoropolymers (polymeric or elastomeric materials with more than 35% fluorine by weight);
Glass (including vitrified or enamelled coatings or glass lining);
Graphite or ‘carbon graphite’; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;
Tantalum or tantalum ‘alloys’;
Titanium or titanium ‘alloys’;
Zirconium or zirconium ‘alloys’;
Niobium (columbium) or niobium ‘alloys’; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.continued: In 2B350(i), the term seal refers to only those seals that come into direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed (or is designed to), and provide a sealing function where a rotary or reciprocating drive shaft passes through a pump body. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: Incinerators designed to destroy chemicals controlled by 1C350, having specially designed waste supply systems, special handling facilities and an average combustion chamber temperature greater than 1 273 K (1 000°C), in which all surfaces in the waste supply system that come into direct contact with the waste products are made from or lined with any of the following materials:

subparagraph.content: ‘Alloys’ with more than 25% nickel and 20% chromium by weight;
Ceramics; or
Nickel or ‘alloys’ with more than 40% nickel by weight;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: Prefabricated repair assemblies having metallic surfaces that come in direct contact with the chemical(s) being processed that are made from tantalum or tantalum alloys as follows, and specially designed components for such prefabricated repair assemblies:

subparagraph.content: Designed for mechanical attachment to glass-lined reaction vessels or reactors specified in 2B350(a); or
Designed for mechanical attachment to glass-lined storage tanks, containers or receivers specified in 2B350(c); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.continued: For the purposes of 2B350, the materials used for gaskets, packing, seals, screws, washers or other materials performing a sealing function do not determine the status of control, provided that such components are designed to be interchangeable. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

paragraph.content: ‘Carbon graphite’ is a composition consisting of amorphous carbon and graphite, in which the graphite content is eight percent or more by weight.

For the listed materials in the above entries, the term ‘alloy’ when not accompanied by a specific elemental concentration is understood as identifying those alloys where the identified metal is present in a higher percentage by weight than any other element. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: Toxic gas monitors and monitoring systems and their dedicated detecting components, other than those specified in 1A004, as follows; and detectors, sensor devices and replaceable sensor cartridges for the monitors, systems and components: (L.N. 161 of 2011; L.N. 89 of 2021; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Designed for continuous operation and usable for the detection of chemical warfare agents or chemicals controlled by 1C350, with a ‘minimum detection limit’ of less than 0.3 mg/m3; or (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 6 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Designed for the detection of cholinesterase-inhibiting activity;

subsection.continued: The ‘minimum detection limit’ of toxic gas monitors or monitoring systems is the lowest detectable concentration of the analyte required to produce a signal greater than three times the standard deviation of the toxic gas monitor’s or monitoring system’s signal when measuring a blank sample.

In the case of toxic gas monitors or monitoring systems having a deadband or programmed zero suppression, the ‘minimum detection limit’ is the lowest detectable concentration required to produce a reading. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: Biological manufacturing and handling equipment, as follows: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Containment facilities and related equipment as follows:

subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment designed for fixed installation in containment facilities specified in 2B352(a), as follows:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Double-door pass-through decontamination autoclaves;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Breathing air suit decontamination showers;

subparagraph.name: c

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Fermenters and components as follows:

subparagraph.content: Fermenters capable of cultivation of “microorganisms” or of live cells for the production of viruses or toxins, without the propagation of aerosols, and having a total internal volume of 20 litres or more; (L.N. 89 of 2021; L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: Components designed for fermenters specified in 2B352(b)(1) as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Cultivation chambers designed to be sterilized or disinfected in situ;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Cultivation chamber holding devices;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Process control units capable of simultaneously monitoring and controlling 2 or more fermentation system parameters (e.g. temperature, pH, nutrients, agitation, dissolved oxygen, air flow, foam control); (L.N. 42 of 2017)
For the purposes of 2B352(b), fermenters include bioreactors, single-use (disposable) bioreactors, chemostats and continuous-flow systems.
Cultivation chamber holding devices include single-use cultivation chambers with rigid walls. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Centrifugal separators, capable of continuous separation without the propagation of aerosols, having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Flow rate exceeding 100 litres per hour;
Components of polished stainless steel or titanium;
One or more sealing joints within the steam containment area; and
Capable of in situ steam sterilization in a closed state; (E.R. 6 of 2020)

paragraph.continued:
Technical Note:
Centrifugal separators include decanters.

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Cross (tangential) flow filtration equipment and component as follows:

subparagraph.leadIn: Cross (tangential) flow filtration equipment capable of separation of “microorganisms”, viruses, toxins or cell cultures, that meets all of the following descriptions: (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021; L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A total filtration area equal to or greater than 1 m2; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Meeting any of the following descriptions:

subparagraph.content: Capable of being ‘sterilized’ or ‘disinfected’ in situ;

subparagraph.continued: In 2B352(d)(1)(b), ‘sterilized’ denotes the elimination of all viable microbes from the equipment through the use of either physical (e.g. steam) or chemical agents. ‘Disinfected’ denotes a process to reduce the number of microorganisms but not usually of bacterial spores, through the use of chemical agents, without necessarily killing or removing all organisms. (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: Cross (tangential) flow filtration components (e.g. modules, elements, cassettes, cartridges, units or plates) with filtration area equal to or greater than 0.2 m2 for each component and designed for use in cross (tangential) flow filtration equipment controlled by 2B352(d);

paragraph.continued: 2B352(d) does not control reverse osmosis and hemodialysis equipment, as specified by the manufacturer. (L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Steam, gas or vapour sterilizable freeze drying equipment with a condenser capacity of 10 kg of ice or more in 24 hours and less than 1 000 kg of ice in 24 hours; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: Protective and containment equipment, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Protective full or half suits, or hoods dependent upon a tethered external air supply and operating under positive pressure;
2B352(f)(1) does not control suits designed to be worn with self-contained breathing apparatus.

subparagraph.leadIn: Biocontainment chambers, isolators, or biological safety cabinets having all of the following characteristics, for normal operation:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Fully enclosed workspace where the operator is separated from the work by a physical barrier;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Able to operate at negative pressure;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Means to safely manipulate items in the workspace;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Supply and exhaust air to and from the workspace is HEPA filtered;

2B352(f)(2) includes Class III biosafety cabinets, as described in the latest edition of the WHO Laboratory Biosafety Manual or constructed in accordance with national standards, regulations or guidance.

2B352(f)(2) includes any isolator meeting all the characteristics mentioned in 2B352(f)(2)(a) to (d), regardless of its intended use and its designation, except for medical isolators specially designed for barrier nursing or transportation of infected patients. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: Aerosol inhalation equipment designed for aerosol challenge testing with “microorganisms”, viruses or “toxins” as follows:

subparagraph.content: Whole-body exposure chambers having a capacity of 1 m3 or more;

subparagraph.leadIn: Nose-only exposure apparatus utilizing directed aerosol flow and having capacity for exposure of any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: 12 or more rodents;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: 2 or more animals other than rodents;
Closed animal restraint tubes designed for use with nose-only exposure apparatus utilizing directed aerosol flow; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: Spray-drying equipment capable of drying toxins or pathogenic “microorganisms”, that meets all of the following descriptions: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Having a water evaporation capacity of ≥ 0.4 kg/h and ≤ 400 kg/h;

Having the ability to generate a typical mean product particle size of ≤ 10 μm with existing fittings or by minimal modification of the spray-dryer with atomization nozzles enabling generation of the required particle size;
Capable of being sterilized or disinfected in situ; (L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.content: Nucleic acid assemblers and synthesisers, which are partly or entirely automated, and designed to generate continuous nucleic acids greater than 1.5 kilobases in length with error rates less than 5% in a single run; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

section.name: s0
section.content: Materials
None.

section.name: s0
section.content: Software

subsection.leadIn: “Software”, other than that specified in 2D002, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “development” or “production” of equipment specified in 2A001 or 2B001 to 2B009; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “use” of equipment specified in 2A001(c), 2B001 or 2B003 to 2B009;

subsection.continued: 2D001 does not control part programming “software” that generates “numerical control” codes for machining various parts.

subsection.leadIn: “Software” for electronic devices, even when residing in an electronic device or system, enabling such devices or systems to function as a “numerical control” unit, capable of coordinating simultaneously more than 4 axes for “contouring control”;

paragraph.content: 2D002 does not control “software” specially designed or modified for the operation of items not specified in Category 2. (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 42 of 2017)
2D002 does not control “software” for items specified in 2B002. See 2D001 and 2D003 for “software” for items specified in 2B002. (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 42 of 2017)
2D002 does not control “software” that is exported with, and the minimum necessary for the operation of, items not specified in Category 2. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subsection.content: “Software”, designed or modified for the operation of equipment specified in 2B002, that converts optical designs, workpiece measurements and material removal functions into “numerical control” commands to achieve the desired workpiece form;
“Software” specially designed or modified for the “use” of equipment controlled by 2B104, 2B105, 2B109, 2B116, 2B117 or 2B119 to 2B122; (L.N. 95 of 2006)

N.B.:
See also 9D004.
“Software” specially designed for the “use” of equipment controlled by 2B204, 2B206, 2B207, 2B209, 2B219 or 2B227;
“Software” specially designed or modified for the “development”, “production” or “use” of equipment specified in 2B201;
2D202 does not control part programming “software” that generates “numerical control” command codes but does not allow direct use of equipment for machining various parts. (L.N. 42 of 2017)
“Software”, other than that specified in 1D003, specially designed for “use” of equipment specified in 2B351;

section.name: s0
section.content: Technology

subsection.content: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development” of equipment or “software” controlled by 2A, 2B or 2D;
2E001 includes “technology” for the integration of probe systems into coordinate measurement machines (CMM) specified in 2B006(a). (L.N. 89 of 2013; L.N. 42 of 2017)
“Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “production” of equipment controlled by 2A or 2B;

subsection.leadIn: Other “technology”, as follows:

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: “Technology” for metal-working manufacturing processes, as follows:

subparagraph.leadIn: “Technology” for the design of tools, dies or fixtures specially designed for any of the following processes:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Superplastic forming”;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: “Diffusion bonding”; or

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: ‘Direct-acting hydraulic pressing’; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
‘Direct-acting hydraulic pressing’ is a deformation process which uses a fluid-filled flexible bladder in direct contact with the workpiece. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.leadIn: For “technology” for metal-working manufacturing processes for gas turbine engines and components, see 9E003 and ML22. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
e
f
paragraph.content: “Technology” for the application of inorganic overlay coatings or inorganic surface modification coatings (specified in column 3 of the following table) to non-electronic substrates (specified in column 2 of the following table), by processes specified in column 1 of the following table and defined in the Technical Note;

This Table should be read to control the “technology” of a particular ‘Coating Process’ only when the Resultant Coating in column 3 is in a paragraph directly across from the relevant ‘Substrate’ under column 2. For example, Chemical Vapour Deposition (CVD) ‘coating process’ technical data are controlled for the application of ‘Silicides’ to ‘Carbon-carbon, Ceramic and Metal “matrix” “composites”’ substrates, but are not controlled for the application of ‘Silicides’ to ‘Cemented tungsten carbide(16), Silicon carbide(18)’ substrates. In the second case, the resultant coating is not listed in the paragraph under column 3 directly across from the paragraph under column 2 listing ‘Cemented tungsten carbide(16), Silicon carbide(18)’. (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.content: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “use” of equipment or “software” specified in 2A225, 2A226, 2B001, 2B006, 2B007(b), 2B007(c), 2B008, 2B009, 2B201, 2B204, 2B206, 2B207, 2B209, 2B225 to 2B233, 2D201 or 2D202;
“Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “use” of goods controlled by 2B350 to 2B352;
