subparagraph.content: Nano-imprint lithography tools; and

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Step and flash imprint lithography (S-FIL) tools. (L.N. 254 of 2008)

subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment specially designed for mask making having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Using deflected focussed electron beam, ion beam or “laser” beam;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: A full-width half-maximum (FWHM) spot size smaller than 65 nm and an image placement less than 17 nm (mean + 3 sigma); (L.N. 89 of 2021)
A second-layer overlay error of less than 23 nm (mean + 3 sigma) on the mask; (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment designed for device processing using direct writing methods, having all of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A deflected focused electron beam;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Having any of the following:

subparagraph.content: A minimum beam size equal to or smaller than 15 nm;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Masks and reticles designed for integrated circuits controlled by 3A001;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: Multi-layer masks with a phase shift layer not specified in 3B001(g) and designed to be used by lithography equipment having a light source wavelength less than 245 nm; (L.N. 89 of 2021)
paragraph.continued: 3B001(h) does not apply to multi-layer masks with a phase shift layer designed for the fabrication of memory devices not specified in 3A001. (L.N. 89 of 2013)
For masks and reticles, specially designed for optical sensors, see 6B002. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: Imprint lithography templates designed for integrated circuits specified in 3A001; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: Mask “substrate blanks” with multilayer reflector structure consisting of molybdenum and silicon, and having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: Specially designed for ‘Extreme Ultraviolet’ (‘EUV’) lithography;
Compliant with SEMI Standard P37;

paragraph.continued: ‘Extreme Ultraviolet’ (‘EUV’) refers to electromagnetic spectrum wavelengths greater than 5 nm and less than 124 nm. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Test equipment, specially designed for testing finished or unfinished semiconductor devices, as follows, and specially designed components and accessories therefor: (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: For testing S-parameters of items controlled by 3A001(b)(3); (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: For testing items controlled by 3A001(b)(2); (L.N. 132 of 2001)

section.name: s0
section.content: Materials

subsection.leadIn: Hetero-epitaxial materials consisting of a “substrate” having stacked epitaxially grown multiple layers of any of the following:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Silicon;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Germanium; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Silicon carbide; or (L.N. 132 of 2001)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: “III/V compounds” of gallium or indium; (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 85 of 2023)

3C001(d) does not apply to a “substrate” having one or more P-type epitaxial layers of GaN, InGaN, AlGaN, InAlN, InAlGaN, GaP, GaAs, AlGaAs, InP, InGaP, AlInP or InGaAlP, independent of the sequence of the elements, except if the P-type epitaxial layer is between N-type layers. (L.N. 89 of 2013; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Gallium Oxide (Ga2O3); (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Diamond; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Resist materials, as follows, and “substrates” coated with the following resists: (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Resists designed for semiconductor lithography as follows:

subparagraph.content: Positive resists adjusted (optimized) for use at wavelengths less than 193 nm but equal to or greater than 15 nm; (L.N. 89 of 2021)
Resists adjusted (optimized) for use at wavelengths less than 15 nm but greater than 1 nm; (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: All resists designed for use with electron beams or ion beams, with a sensitivity of 0.01 μcoulomb/mm2 or better;

paragraph.name: d

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: All resists designed or optimized for use with imprint lithography equipment specified in 3B001(f)(2) that use either a thermal or photo-curable process; (L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 45 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: Organo-inorganic compounds, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Organo-metallic compounds of aluminium, gallium or indium having a purity (metal basis) greater (better) than 99.999%;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Organo-arsenic, organo-antimony and organo-phosphorus compounds having a purity (inorganic element basis) greater (better) than 99.999%;
3C003 only controls compounds whose metallic, partly metallic or non-metallic element is directly linked to carbon in the organic part of the molecule.

subsection.content: Hydrides of phosphorus, arsenic or antimony, having a purity greater (better) than 99.999%, even diluted in inert gases or hydrogen; (L.N. 6 of 2025)
3C004 does not control hydrides containing 20% molar or more of inert gases or hydrogen.

subsection.leadIn: High resistivity materials as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Silicon carbide (SiC), gallium nitride (GaN), aluminium nitride (AlN), aluminium gallium nitride (AlGaN), gallium oxide (Ga2O3) or diamond semiconductor “substrates”, or ingots, boules, or other preforms of those materials, having resistivities greater than 10 000 ohm-cm at 20°C;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Polycrystalline “substrates” or polycrystalline ceramic “substrates”, having resistivities greater than 10 000 ohm-cm at 20°C and having at least one non-epitaxial single-crystal layer of silicon (Si), silicon carbide (SiC), gallium nitride (GaN), aluminium nitride (AlN), aluminium gallium nitride (AlGaN), gallium oxide (Ga2O3) or diamond on the surface of the “substrate”;

subsection.content: Materials, not specified in 3C001, consisting of a “substrate” specified in 3C005 with at least one epitaxial layer of silicon carbide (SiC), gallium nitride (GaN), aluminium nitride (AIN), aluminium gallium nitride (AIGaN), gallium oxide (Ga2O3) or diamond

section.name: s
section.content: Software

subsection.content: “Software” specially designed for the “development” or “production” of equipment controlled by 3A001(b) to 3A002(h) or 3B;

subsection.leadIn:
“Software” specially designed for the “use” of equipment specified in
3B001(a), 3B001(b), 3B001(e), 3B001(f) or 3B002;

subsection.content: ‘Computational lithography’ “software” specially designed for the “development” of patterns on EUV-lithography masks or reticles;

‘Computational lithography’ is the use of computer modelling to predict, correct, optimize and verify imaging performance of the lithography process over a range of patterns, processes, and system conditions.
“Software” specially designed for the “development” of the equipment controlled by 3A003;

“Software” specially designed to restore normal operation of a microcomputer, “microprocessor microcircuit” or “microcomputer microcircuit” within 1 ms after an Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP) or Electrostatic Discharge (ESD) disruption, without loss of continuation of operation;

subsection.leadIn: ‘Electronic Computer-Aided Design’ (‘ECAD’) “software” specially designed for the “development” of integrated circuits having any “Gate-All-Around Field-Effect Transistor” (“GAAFET”) structure, and having any of the following:

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: Specially designed for optimization of power or timing rules;
‘Electronic Computer-Aided Design’ (‘ECAD’) is a category of “software” tools used for designing, analyzing, optimizing, and validating the performance of integrated circuit or printed circuit board.

‘Register Transfer Level’ (‘RTL’) is a design abstraction which models a synchronous digital circuit in terms of the flow of digital signals between hardware registers, and the logical operations performed on those signals.
‘Geometrical Database Standard II’ (‘GDSII’) is a database file format for data exchange of integrated circuit or integrated circuit layout artwork.

subsection.content: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “use” of equipment controlled by 3A101(b);
“Software” specially designed to enhance or release the performance of a frequency changer or generator to meet the characteristics of 3A225;

section.name: s0
section.content: Technology

subsection.leadIn: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development” or “production” of equipment or materials specified in 3A, 3B or 3C;

paragraph.content: 3E001 does not include “technology” for equipment or components specified in 3A003. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.leadIn: 3E001 does not include “technology” for integrated circuits specified in 3A001(a)(3) to (12), having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Using “technology” at or above 0.130 μm; (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Incorporating multi-layer structures with three or fewer metal layers. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.content: 3E001 does not control ‘Process Design Kits’ (‘PDKs’) unless they include libraries implementing functions or technologies for items specified in 3A001.

A ‘Process Design Kit’ (‘PDK’) is a software tool provided by a semiconductor manufacturer to ensure that the required design practices and rules are taken into account in order to successfully produce a specific integrated circuit design in a specific semiconductor process, in accordance with technological and manufacturing constraints (each semiconductor manufacturing process has its particular ‘PDK’). (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note other than that specified in 3E001 for the “development” or “production” of a “microprocessor microcircuit”, “microcomputer microcircuit” or microcontroller microcircuit core, having an arithmetic logic unit with an access width of 32 bits or more and any of the following features or characteristics:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A ‘vector processor unit’ designed to perform more than two calculations on ‘floating-point’ vectors (one-dimensional arrays of 32-bit or larger numbers) simultaneously;

A ‘vector processor unit’ is a processor element with built-in instructions that perform multiple calculations on ‘floating-point’ vectors (one-dimensional arrays of 32-bit or larger numbers) simultaneously, having at least one vector arithmetic logic unit and vector registers of at least 32 elements each. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Designed to perform more than four 64-bit or larger ‘floating-point’ operation results per cycle; (L.N. 27 of 2015)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Designed to perform more than eight 16-bit ‘fixed-point’ multiply-accumulate results per cycle (e.g. digital manipulation of analogue information that has been previously converted into digital form, also known as digital “signal processing”); (E.R. 6 of 2020; L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: For the purposes of 3E002(a) and 3E002(b), ‘floating-point’ is defined by IEEE-754.

For the purposes of 3E002(c), ‘fixed-point’ refers to a fixed-width real number with both an integer component and a fractional component, and which does not include integer-only formats. (L.N. 85 of 2023)
3E002 does not control “technology” for multimedia extensions. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.leadIn: 3E002 does not include “technology” for microprocessor cores, having all of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Using “technology” at or above 0.130 μm;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Incorporating multi-layer structures with 5 or fewer metal layers. (L.N. 89 of 2021)
3E002 includes “technology” for the “development” or “production” of digital signal processors and digital array processors. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Other “technology” for the “development” or “production” of:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Vacuum microelectronic devices;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Hetero-structure semiconductor electronic devices such as high electron mobility transistors (HEMT), hetero-bipolar transistors (HBT), quantum well and super lattice devices; (L.N. 89 of 2013)

3E003(b) does not control “technology” for high electron mobility transistors (HEMT) operating at frequencies lower than 31.8 GHz and hetero-junction bipolar transistors (HBT) operating at frequencies lower than 31.8 GHz. (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: “Superconductive” electronic devices;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Substrates of diamond for electronic components; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Substrates of silicon-on-insulator (SOI) for integrated circuits in which the insulator is silicon dioxide;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: “Vacuum electronic devices” operating at frequencies of 31.8 GHz or higher; (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: h

subsection.content: “Technology” “required” for the slicing, grinding and polishing of 300 mm diameter silicon wafers to achieve a ‘Site Front least sQuares Range’ (‘SFQR’) less than or equal to 20 nm at any site of 26 mm × 8 mm on the front surface of the wafer and an edge exclusion less than or equal to 2 mm.

For the purposes of 3E004, ‘SFQR’ is the range of maximum deviation and minimum deviation from front reference plane, calculated by least square method with all front surface data including site boundary within a site.
“Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development” of “software” controlled by 3D101;

paragraph.content: Computers, related equipment and “software” performing telecommunications or “local area network” functions must also be evaluated against the performance characteristics of Category 5, Part 1 (Telecommunications). (L.N. 132 of 2001)

Control units which directly interconnect the buses or channels of central processing units, ‘main storage’ or disk controllers are not regarded as telecommunications equipment described in Category 5, Part 1 (Telecommunications). (L.N. 85 of 2023)
For the control status of “software” specially designed for packet switching, see Category 5D001 (Telecommunications). (L.N. 132 of 2001)

‘Main storage’ is the primary storage for data or instructions for rapid access by a central processing unit. It consists of the internal storage of a “digital computer” and any hierarchical extension to the “digital computer”, such as cache storage or non-sequentially accessed extended storage. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

section.name: s0
section.content: Systems, Equipment and Components

subsection.leadIn: Electronic computers and related equipment, as follows, and “electronic assemblies” and specially designed components therefor:
See also 4A101.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Specially designed to have any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.content: Rated for operation at an ambient temperature below 228 K (-45°C) or above 358 K (85°C);
4A001(a)(1) does not apply to computers specially designed for civil automobile, railway train or “civil aircraft” applications. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.leadIn: Radiation hardened to exceed any of the following specifications:
subparagraph.continued: 4A001(a)(2) does not apply to computers specially designed for “civil aircraft” applications. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Deleted; (L.N. 45 of 2010)

subsection.content: Deleted; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: “Digital computers”, “electronic assemblies”, and related equipment therefor, as follows, and specially designed components therefor:

paragraph.leadIn: 4A003 includes the following:

subparagraph.name: a
b
subparagraph.content: Array processors;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Digital signal processors;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Logic processors;

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Equipment designed for “image enhancement”;

paragraph.leadIn: The control status of the “digital computers” and related equipment described in 4A003 is determined by the control status of other equipment or systems provided:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: The “digital computers” or related equipment are essential for the operation of the other equipment or systems;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: The “digital computers” or related equipment are not a “principal element” of the other equipment or systems; and

subparagraph.content: The control status of “signal processing” or “image enhancement” equipment specially designed for other equipment with functions limited to those required for the other equipment is determined by the control status of the other equipment even if it exceeds the “principal element” criterion.
For the control status of “digital computers” or related equipment for telecommunications equipment, see Category 5, Part 1 (Telecommunications).

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: The “technology” for the “digital computers” and related equipment is determined by 4E.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Digital computers” having an “Adjusted Peak Performance” (“APP”) exceeding 70 Weighted TeraFLOPS (WT); (L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 45 of 2010; L.N. 89 of 2013; L.N. 27 of 2015; L.N. 89 of 2021; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: “Electronic assemblies” specially designed or modified for enhancing performance by aggregation of processors so that the “APP” of the aggregation exceeds the limit in 4A003(b); (L.N. 183 of 1999; L.N. 95 of 2006)

subparagraph.content: 4A003(c) applies only to “electronic assemblies” and programmable interconnections not exceeding the limit in 4A003(b), when shipped as unintegrated “electronic assemblies”. (L.N. 183 of 1999; L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 89 of 2021)
4A003(c) does not control “electronic assemblies” specially designed for a product or family of products whose maximum configuration does not exceed the limit of 4A003(b).

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Deleted; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Deleted;
For “electronic assemblies”, modules or equipment, performing analogue-to-digital conversions, see 3A002(h). (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Equipment specially designed for aggregating the performance of “digital computers” by providing external interconnections that allow communications at unidirectional data rates exceeding 2.0 Gbyte/s per link; (L.N. 45 of 2010)

4A003(g) does not apply to internal interconnection equipment (e.g. backplanes, buses), passive interconnection equipment, “network access controllers” or “communications channel controllers”. (L.N. 183 of 1999; L.N. 45 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: Computers, as follows, and specially designed related equipment, “electronic assemblies” and components therefor:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Systolic array computers”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Neural computers”;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: “Optical computers”;

subsection.content: Systems, equipment, and components for the systems and equipment, specially designed or modified for the generation, command and control or delivery of “intrusion software”;

Analogue computers, “digital computer” or digital differential analysers, other than those controlled by 4A001(a)(1), which are ruggedized and designed or modified for use in space launch vehicles controlled by 9A004 or sounding rockets controlled by 9A104;

Hybrid computers specially designed for modelling, simulation or design integration of space launch vehicles controlled by 9A004 or sounding rockets controlled by 9A104; (L.N. 183 of 1999; L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 89 of 2021)
4A102 only applies when the equipment is supplied with “software” controlled by 7D103 or 9D103.

section.name: s0
section.content: Test, Inspection and Production Equipment
None

section.name: s0
section.content: Materials
None

section.name: s0
section.content: Software
The status of “software” for equipment described in other Categories is dealt with in the appropriate Category. (L.N. 45 of 2010; L.N. 89 of 2013)

subsection.leadIn: “Software” as follows: (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “development” or “production” of equipment or “software” specified in 4A or 4D; (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: “Software”, other than that controlled by 4D001(a), specially designed or modified for the “development” or “production” of:

subparagraph.content: “Digital computers” having an “Adjusted Peak Performance” (“APP”) exceeding 24 Weighted TeraFLOPS (WT); or (L.N. 226 of 2009; L.N. 45 of 2010; L.N. 27 of 2015; L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021; L.N. 6 of 2025)

“Electronic assemblies” specially designed or modified for enhancing performance by aggregation of processors so that the “APP” of the aggregation exceeds the limit in 4D001(b)(1); (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 95 of 2006)

subsection.content: Deleted; (L.N. 45 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: “Software” specially designed or modified for the generation, command and control or delivery of “intrusion software”;
subsection.continued: 4D004 does not apply to “software” specially designed and limited to provide “software” updates or upgrades meeting all of the following:

paragraph.content: The update or upgrade operates only with the authorization of the owner or administrator of the system receiving it;

paragraph.leadIn: After the update or upgrade, the “software” updated or upgraded is not any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Software” specified in 4D004;

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Intrusion software”.

section.name: s0
section.content: Technology

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note, for the “development”, “production” or “use” of equipment or “software” controlled by 4A or 4D; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: “Technology”, according to the General Technology Note, other than that controlled by 4E001(a), for the “development” or “production” of: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: “Digital computers” having an “Adjusted Peak Performance” (“APP”) exceeding 24 Weighted TeraFLOPS (WT); or (L.N. 226 of 2009; L.N. 45 of 2010; L.N. 27 of 2015; L.N. 42 of 2017; L.N. 89 of 2021; L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.leadIn: “Electronic assemblies” specially designed or modified for enhancing performance by aggregation of processors so that the “APP” of the aggregation exceeds the limit in 4E001(b)(1); (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: c

paragraph.content: 4E001(a) and 4E001(c) do not control “vulnerability disclosure” or “cyber incident response”.
Note 1 does not diminish the rights of the competent authority of the country in which the exporter is established to ascertain compliance with 4E001(a) and 4E001(c). (L.N. 85 of 2023)

td.p: “APP” is an adjusted peak rate at which “digital computers” perform 64-bit or larger floating point additions and multiplications.

p.i: Abbreviations used in this Technical Note:

td.p: number of processors in the “digital computer”
“APP” is expressed in Weighted TeraFLOPS (WT), in units of 1012 adjusted floating point operations per second.

section.name: s1
section.content: For each processor i, determine the peak number of 64-bit or larger floating point operations, FPOi, performed per cycle for each processor in the “digital computer”.

In determining FPO, include only 64-bit or larger floating point additions or multiplications or both. All floating point operations must be expressed in operations per processor cycle; operations requiring multiple cycles may be expressed in fractional results per cycle. For processors not capable of performing calculations on floating point operands of 64-bits or more, the effective calculating rate R is zero.

section.name: s2
section.content: Calculate the floating point rate R for each processor
Ri = FPOi/ti

section.name: s3
section.content: Calculate “APP”
“APP” = W1 × R1 + W2 × R2 + . + Wn × Rn

section.name: s4
section.content: For ‘vector processors’, Wi = 0.9. For non-‘vector processors’, Wi = 0.3.

section.name: s1
section.content: For processors that perform compound operations in a cycle, such as addition and multiplication, each operation is counted.

section.name: s2
section.content: For a pipelined processor, the effective calculating rate R is the faster of the pipelined rate, once the pipeline is full, or the non-pipelined rate.

section.name: s3
section.content: The calculating rate R of each contributing processor is to be calculated at its maximum value theoretically possible before the “APP” of the combination is derived. Simultaneous operations are assumed to exist when the computer manufacturer claims concurrent, parallel, or simultaneous operation or execution in a manual or brochure for the computer.

section.name: s4
section.content: Do not include processors that are limited to input/output and peripheral functions (e.g. disk drive, communication and video display) when calculating “APP”. (E.R. 6 of 2020)

section.name: s5
section.content: “APP” values are not to be calculated for processor combinations interconnected by “Local Area Networks”, Wide Area Networks, Input/Output shared connections/devices, Input/Output controllers and any communication interconnection implemented by “software”.

section.name: s6
section.content: “APP” values must be calculated for processor combinations containing processors specially designed to enhance performance by aggregation, operating simultaneously and sharing memory. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: Aggregate all processors and accelerators operating simultaneously and located on the same die.

Processor combinations share memory when any processor is capable of accessing any memory location in the system through the hardware transmission of cache lines or memory words, without the involvement of any “software” mechanism. Processor combinations may be achieved using “electronic assemblies” specified in 4A003(c). (L.N. 89 of 2013, L.N. 42 of 2017)

section.name: s7
section.content: A ‘vector processor’ is defined as a processor with built-in instructions that perform multiple calculations on floating-point vectors (one-dimensional arrays of 64-bit or larger numbers) simultaneously, and having at least 2 vector functional units and at least 8 vector registers of at least 64 elements each.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The status of components, test and “production” equipment and “software” therefor which are specially designed for telecommunications equipment or systems is determined in Category 5, Part 1. (L.N. 45 of 2010)

subsection.content: For “lasers” specially designed for telecommunications equipment or systems, see 6A005. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

section.name: s2
section.content: “Digital computers”, related equipment or “software”, when essential for the operation and support of telecommunications equipment described in this Category, are regarded as specially designed components, provided they are the standard models customarily supplied by the manufacturer. This includes operation, administration, maintenance, engineering or billing computer systems.

section.name: s2
section.content: Systems, Equipment and Components

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Any type of telecommunications equipment having any of the following characteristics, functions or features:

subparagraph.content: Specially hardened to withstand gamma, neutron or ion radiation; or
Specially designed to operate below 218 K (-55°C); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.content: 5A001(a)(3) and 5A001(a)(4) apply only to electronic equipment.
5A001(a)(2), 5A001(a)(3) and 5A001(a)(4) do not control equipment designed or modified for use on board satellites. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Telecommunications systems and equipment, and specially designed components and accessories therefor, having any of the following characteristics, functions or features: (36 of 2000 s. 28; L.N. 254 of 2008)

subparagraph.leadIn: Being underwater untethered communications systems having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: An acoustic carrier frequency outside the range from 20 kHz to 60 kHz;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Using an electromagnetic carrier frequency below 30 kHz;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Using electronic beam steering techniques;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Using “lasers” or light-emitting diodes (LEDs), with an output wavelength greater than 400 nm and less than 700 nm, in a “local area network”; (L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 27 of 2015)

subparagraph.leadIn: Being radio equipment operating in the 1.5 MHz to 87.5 MHz band and having all of the following characteristics: (L.N. 254 of 2008)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Automatically predicting and selecting frequencies and “total digital transfer rates” per channel to optimize the transmission; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Incorporating a linear power amplifier configuration having a capability to support multiple signals simultaneously at an output power of 1 kW or more in the frequency range of 1.5 MHz or more but less than 30 MHz, or 250 W or more in the frequency range of 30 MHz or more but not exceeding 87.5 MHz, over an “instantaneous bandwidth” of one octave or more and with an output harmonic and distortion content of less (better) than -80 dB; (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.leadIn: Being radio equipment employing “spread spectrum” techniques, including “frequency hopping” techniques, not controlled by 5A001(b)(4), and having any of the following characteristics: (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 95 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: User programmable spreading codes; or

subparagraph.name: b

content.leadIn: 5A001(b)(3)(b) does not apply to radio equipment specially designed for use with any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Civil cellular radiocommunications systems;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Fixed or mobile satellite earth stations for commercial civil telecommunications. (L.N. 89 of 2013)

subparagraph.continued: 5A001(b)(3) does not control equipment designed to operate at an output power of 1.0 Watt or less.

subparagraph.leadIn: Being radio equipment employing ultra-wideband modulation techniques, having user programmable channelizing codes, scrambling codes or network identification codes, and having any of the following characteristics:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A bandwidth exceeding 500 MHz; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: A “fractional bandwidth” of 20% or more; (L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 226 of 2009)

subparagraph.leadIn: Being digitally controlled radio receivers having all of the following: (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: More than 1 000 channels;

subparagraph.name: b
c
subparagraph.content: Automatic searching or scanning of a part of the electromagnetic spectrum; and

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Identification of the received signals or the type of transmitter;

subparagraph.continued: 5A001(b)(5) does not apply to radio equipment specially designed for use with civil cellular radiocommunications systems. (L.N. 27 of 2015)

‘Channel switching time’: the time (i.e. delay) to change from one receiving frequency to another, to arrive at or within +0.05% of the final specified receiving frequency. Items having a specified frequency range of less than +0.05% around their centre frequency are defined to be incapable of channel frequency switching. (L.N. 27 of 2015; E.R. 6 of 2020)

subparagraph.content: Employing functions of digital “signal processing” to provide ‘voice coding’ output at rates of less than 700 bit/s; (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 95 of 2006; L.N. 89 of 2021)
For variable rate ‘voice coding’, 5A001(b)(6) applies to the voice coding output of continuous speech.

subparagraph.leadIn: For the purpose of 5A001(b)(6), ‘voice coding’ is defined as the technique to take samples of human voice and then convert these samples into a digital signal, taking into account specific characteristics of human speech. (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: For underwater umbilical cables, see 8A002(a)(3).

‘Proof Test’: on-line or off-line production screen testing that dynamically applies a prescribed tensile stress over a 0.5 to 3 m length of fibre at a running rate of 2 to 5 m/s while passing between capstans approximately 150 mm in diameter. The ambient temperature is a nominal 293 K (20°C) and relative humidity 40%. Equivalent national standards may be used for executing the proof test. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: ‘Electronically steerable phased array antennae’ as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Rated for operation above 31.8 GHz, but not exceeding 57 GHz, and having an Effective Radiated Power (ERP) equal to or greater than +20 dBm (22.15 dBm Effective Isotropic Radiated Power (EIRP));
Rated for operation above 90 GHz;
5A001(d) does not control ‘electronically steerable phased array antennae’ for landing systems with instruments meeting ICAO standards covering microwave landing systems (MLS). (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: 5A001(d) does not control antennae specially designed for any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Civil cellular or WLAN radiocommunications systems;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: IEEE 802.15 or wireless HDMI;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Fixed or mobile satellite earth stations for commercial civil telecommunications. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.continued: For the purposes of 5A001(d), ‘electronically steerable phased array antenna’ is an antenna which forms a beam by means of phase coupling (i.e. the beam direction is controlled by the complex excitation coefficients of the radiating elements), and the direction of that beam can be varied (both in transmission and reception) in azimuth or in elevation, or both, by application of an electrical signal. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: Radio direction finding equipment operating at frequencies above 30 MHz and having all of the following characteristics, and specially designed components therefor:

subparagraph.content: “Instantaneous bandwidth” of 10 MHz or more; and
Capable of finding a line of bearing (LOB) to non-cooperating radio transmitters with a signal duration of less than 1 ms; (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: Mobile telecommunications interception or jamming equipment, and monitoring equipment, as follows, and specially designed components for those equipment: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Interception equipment designed for the extraction of voice or data, transmitted over the air interface;

Interception equipment not specified in 5A001(f)(1), designed for the extraction of client device or subscriber identifiers (e.g. IMSI, TIMSI or IMEI), signalling, or other metadata transmitted over the air interface; (E.R. 6 of 2020)

subparagraph.leadIn: Jamming equipment specially designed or modified to intentionally and selectively interfere with, deny, inhibit, degrade or seduce mobile telecommunication services and performing any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Simulate the functions of Radio Access Network (RAN) equipment;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Detect and exploit specific characteristics of the mobile telecommunications protocol employed (e.g. GSM); (E.R. 6 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Exploit specific characteristics of the mobile telecommunications protocol employed (e.g. GSM); (E.R. 6 of 2020)

continued.leadIn: 5A001(f)(1) and 5A001(f)(2) do not apply to any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Equipment specially designed for the interception of analogue Private Mobile Radio (PMR), IEEE 802.11 WLAN;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Equipment designed for mobile telecommunications network operators;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Equipment designed for the “development” or “production” of mobile telecommunications equipment or systems.
See also the Munitions List.
For radio receivers, see 5A001(b)(5). (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Passive Coherent Location (PCL) systems or equipment, specially designed for detecting and tracking moving objects by measuring reflections of ambient radio frequency emissions, supplied by non-radar transmitters;

Technical Note:Non-radar transmitters may include commercial radio, television or cellular telecommunications base stations.Note:5A001(g) does not include any of the following:(a)Radio-astronomical equipment;(b)Systems or equipment, that require any radio transmission from the target. (L.N. 254 of 2008)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: Counter Improvised Explosive Device (IED) equipment and related equipment, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Radio Frequency (RF) transmitting equipment, not specified in 5A001(f), designed or modified for prematurely activating or preventing the initiation of Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs); (L.N. 85 of 2023)
Equipment using techniques designed to enable radio communications in the same frequency channels on which co-located equipment specified in 5A001(h)(1) is transmitting;

paragraph.continued: See also the Munitions List. (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: Not used; (L.N. 27 of 2015)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: IP network communications surveillance systems or equipment, and specially designed components for the systems or equipment, having all of the following:

subparagraph.leadIn: Performing all of the following on a carrier class IP network (e.g. national grade IP backbone): (E.R. 6 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Analysis at the application layer (e.g. Layer 7 of Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model (ISO/IEC 7498-1));

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Extraction of selected metadata and application content (e.g. voice, video, messages, attachments);

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Indexing of extracted data; (E.R. 6 of 2020)

subparagraph.leadIn: Being specially designed to carry out all of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Execution of searches on the basis of “hard selectors”; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Mapping of the relational network of an individual or of a group of people;

continued.leadIn: 5A001(j) does not apply to systems or equipment, specially designed for any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Marketing purpose;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Network Quality of Service (QoS);

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Quality of Experience (QoE). (L.N. 27 of 2015)

subsection.leadIn: Telemetry and telecontrol equipment, including ground equipment, designed or modified for ‘missiles’; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
In 5A101, ‘missiles’ means complete rocket systems and “unmanned aerial vehicle” systems capable of a range exceeding 300 km.
5A101 does not control:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Equipment designed or modified for manned aircraft or satellites;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Ground based equipment designed or modified for terrestrial or marine applications;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Equipment designed for commercial, civil or safety of life (e.g. data integrity, flight safety) GNSS services.

section.name: s2
section.content: Test, Inspection and Production Equipment

subsection.leadIn: Telecommunication test, inspection and production equipment, components and accessories, as follows: (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: a

subsection.continued: 5B001(a) does not apply to optical fibre characterization equipment. (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Equipment and specially designed components or accessories therefor, specially designed for the “development” of any of the following telecommunications transmission or switching equipment: (36 of 2000 s. 28; L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment employing a “laser” and having any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A transmission wavelength exceeding 1 750 nm;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Employing analogue techniques and having a bandwidth exceeding 2.5 GHz;
5B001(b)(2)(d) does not apply to equipment specially designed for the “development” of commercial TV systems. (L.N. 89 of 2013)
Radio equipment employing quadrature-amplitude-modulation (QAM) techniques above level 1 024; (L.N. 89 of 2013; L.N. 89 of 2021)

section.name: s2
section.content: Materials
None;

section.name: s2
section.content: Software

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “development”, “production” or “use” of equipment, functions or features, specified in 5A001; (L.N. 226 of 2009)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Specific “software” specially designed or modified to provide characteristics, functions or features of equipment controlled by 5A001 or 5B001; (L.N. 95 of 2006)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “development” of any of the following telecommunications transmission or switching equipment: (36 of 2000 s. 28; L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment employing a “laser” and having any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A transmission wavelength exceeding 1 750 nm; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Employing analogue techniques and having a bandwidth exceeding 2.5 GHz; or (L.N. 45 of 2010)
5D001(d)(2)(b) does not control “software” specially designed or modified for the “development” of commercial TV systems. (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 89 of 2021)
Radio equipment employing quadrature-amplitude-modulation (QAM) techniques above level 1 024; (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: “Software”, other than that specified in 5D001(a) or 5D001(c), specially designed or modified for monitoring or analysis for law enforcement purposes, providing all of the following: (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: Execution of searches on the basis of “hard selectors” of either the content of communication or metadata acquired from a communications service provider using a ‘handover interface’;

Mapping of the relational network or tracking the movement or location of targeted individuals based on the results of searches on content of communication or metadata or searches as described in 5D001(e)(1); (L.N. 6 of 2025)

For the purposes of 5D001(e), a ‘handover interface’ is a physical and logical interface, designed for use by an authorized law enforcement authority, across which targeted interception measures are requested from a communications service provider and the results of interception are delivered from a communications service provider to the requesting authority. The ‘handover interface’ is implemented within systems or equipment (e.g. mediation devices) that receive and validate the interception request, and deliver to the requesting authority only the results of interception that fulfil the validated request.
‘Handover interfaces’ may be specified by international standards (including but not limited to ETSI TS 101 331, ETSI TS 101 671 or 3GPP TS 33.108) or national equivalents. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

continued.leadIn: 5D001(e) does not control “software” specially designed or modified for any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Billing purposes;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Network Quality of Service (QoS);

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Quality of Experience (QoE);

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Mediation devices;

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Mobile payment or banking use. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subsection.content: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “use” of equipment controlled by 5A101;

section.name: s2
section.content: Technology

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development”, “production” or “use” (excluding operation) of equipment, functions or features specified in 5A001 or “software” specified in 5D001(a) or 5D001(e); (L.N. 226 of 2009; L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Specific “technologies”, as follows:

subparagraph.content: “Technology” “required” for the “development” or “production” of telecommunications equipment specially designed to be used on board satellites; (L.N. 85 of 2023)

“Technology” for the “development” or “use” of “laser” communication techniques with the capability of automatically acquiring and tracking signals and maintaining communications through exoatmosphere or sub-surface (water) media;

“Technology” for the “development” of digital cellular radio base station receiving equipment whose reception capabilities that allow multi-band, multi-channel, multi-mode, multi-coding algorithm or multi-protocol operation can be modified by changes in “software”; (L.N. 65 of 2004)
“Technology” for the “development” of “spread spectrum” techniques, including “frequency hopping” techniques; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

content.leadIn: 5E001(b)(4) does not apply to “technology” for the “development” of any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Civil cellular radiocommunications systems;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Fixed or mobile satellite earth stations for commercial civil telecommunications. (L.N. 89 of 2013)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development” or “production” of any of the following telecommunications transmission or switching equipment, functions or features: (36 of 2000 s. 28; L.N. 65 of 2004)

subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment employing a “laser” and having any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A transmission wavelength exceeding 1 750 nm;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Employing wavelength division multiplexing techniques of optical carriers at less than 100 GHz spacing; or (L.N. 226 of 2009)

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Employing analogue techniques and having a bandwidth exceeding 2.5 GHz;
5E001(c)(2)(e) does not control “technology” for commercial TV systems. (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.continued: For “technology” for the “development” or “production” of non-telecommunications equipment employing a laser, see 6E. (L.N. 226 of 2009)

subparagraph.content: Equipment employing “optical switching” and having a switching time less than 1 ms; (L.N. 45 of 2010)

subparagraph.leadIn: Radio equipment having any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Quadrature-amplitude-modulation (QAM) techniques above level 1 024; (L.N. 65 of 2004; L.N. 254 of 2008; L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Operating at input or output frequencies exceeding 31.8 GHz; (L.N. 65 of 2004)

5E001(c)(4)(b) does not control “technology” for equipment designed or modified for operation in any frequency band which is “allocated by the ITU” for radiocommunications services, but not for radio-determination. (L.N. 132 of 2001; L.N. 89 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Operating in the 1.5 MHz to 87.5 MHz band and incorporating adaptive techniques providing more than 15 dB suppression of an interfering signal; (L.N. 254 of 2008)

subparagraph.leadIn: Mobile equipment, as follows:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Operating at an optical wavelength greater than or equal to 200 nm and less than or equal to 400 nm; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Operating as a “local area network”; (L.N. 226 of 2009)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development” or “production” of “Monolithic Microwave Integrated Circuit” (“MMIC”) amplifiers specially designed for telecommunications and that are any of the following: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

For the purposes of 5E001(d), the parameter peak saturated power output may be referred to on product data sheets as output power, saturated power output, maximum power output, peak power output, or peak envelope power output.

subparagraph.leadIn: Rated for operation at frequencies exceeding 2.7 GHz up to and including 6.8 GHz with a “fractional bandwidth” greater than 15%, and having any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
b
c
d

subparagraph.leadIn: Rated for operation at frequencies exceeding 6.8 GHz up to and including 16 GHz with a “fractional bandwidth” greater than 10%, and having any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
b

subparagraph.content: Rated for operation with a peak saturated power output greater than 3 W (34.77 dBm) at any frequency exceeding 16 GHz up to and including 31.8 GHz, and with a “fractional bandwidth” of greater than 10%;
Rated for operation with a peak saturated power output greater than 1 W (30 dBm) at any frequency exceeding 37 GHz up to and including 43.5 GHz, and with a “fractional bandwidth” of greater than 10%;

Rated for operation with a peak saturated power output greater than 31.62 mW (15 dBm) at any frequency exceeding 43.5 GHz up to and including 75 GHz, and with a “fractional bandwidth” of greater than 10%;
Rated for operation with a peak saturated power output greater than 10 mW (10 dBm) at any frequency exceeding 75 GHz up to and including 90 GHz, and with a “fractional bandwidth” of greater than 5%;
Rated for operation with a peak saturated power output greater than 0.1 nW (-70 dBm) at any frequency exceeding 90 GHz; (L.N. 27 of 2015)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development” or “production” of electronic devices and circuits, specially designed for telecommunications and containing components manufactured from “superconductive” materials, specially designed for operation at temperatures below the “critical temperature” of at least one of the “superconductive” constituents, and having any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Current switching for digital circuits using “superconductive” gates with a product of delay time per gate (in seconds) and power dissipation per gate (in watts) of less than 10 -14 J;
Frequency selection at all frequencies using resonant circuits with Q-values exceeding 10 000; (L.N. 226 of 2009)

section.name: s2
section.content: Category 5—Part 2 does not apply to products when accompanying their user for the user’s personal use.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn:
5A002, 5D002(a)(1), 5D002(b) and 5D002(c)(1)
do not apply to items as follows: (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.name: a
subsection.leadIn: Items meeting all of the following:

subparagraph.leadIn: Generally available to the public by being sold, without restriction, from stock at retail selling points by means of any of the following:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Over-the-counter transactions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Mail order transactions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Electronic transactions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Telephone call transactions;

subparagraph.content: The cryptographic functionality cannot easily be changed by the user;
Designed for installation by the user without further substantial support by the supplier;
Deleted;

When necessary, details of the items are accessible and will be provided, upon request, to the appropriate authority in the exporter’s country in order to ascertain compliance with conditions described in paragraph (a)(1), (2) and (3) above;

subsection.name: b
subsection.leadIn: Hardware components, or ‘executable software’, of existing items described in paragraph (a) of this Note, that have been designed for these existing items, meeting all of the following: (L.N. 27 of 2015)

paragraph.content: “Information security” is not the primary function or set of functions of the component or ‘executable software’;
The feature set of the component or ‘executable software’ is fixed and is not designed or modified to customer specification;

When necessary as determined by the appropriate authority in the exporter’s country, details of the component or ‘executable software’ and relevant end-items are accessible and will be provided to the authority upon request, in order to ascertain compliance with conditions described in paragraph (b)(1), (2) and (3) above. (L.N. 27 of 2015)

subsection.continued: For the purposes of the Cryptography Note, ‘executable software’ means “software” in executable form, from an existing hardware component excluded from 5A002 by the Cryptography Note. (L.N. 27 of 2015)
‘Executable software’ does not include complete binary images of the “software” running on an end-item. (L.N. 27 of 2015)

subsection.leadIn: To meet paragraph (a) of Note 3, all of the following must apply:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: The item is of potential interest to a wide range of individuals and businesses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The price and information about the main functionality of the item are available before purchase without the need to consult the vendor or supplier. A simple price enquiry is not considered to be a consultation. (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.content: In determining paragraph (a) of Note 3, national authorities may take into account relevant factors such as quantity, price, required technical skill, existing sales channels, typical customers, typical use or any exclusionary practices of the supplier. (L.N. 89 of 2013)

section.name: s0
section.content: Systems, Equipment and Components

subsection.leadIn: “Information security” systems, equipment and components, as follows:
For “satellite navigation system” receiving equipment containing or employing decryption, see 7A005, and for related decryption “software” and “technology”, see 7D005 and 7E001.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Designed or modified to use ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ as follows: (L.N. 85 of 2023; L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: Items having “information security” as a primary function;
Digital communication or networking systems, equipment or components, not specified in 5A002(a)(1);
For operating systems, see also 5D002(a)(1) and 5D002(c)(1).

subparagraph.leadIn: Items, not specified in 5A002(a)(1), 5A002(a)(2) and 5A002(a)(3), where the ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ meets all of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: It supports a non-primary function of the item;

subparagraph.name: b

subparagraph.leadIn: For the purposes of 5A002(a), ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ means “cryptography” that employs digital techniques for a cryptographic function or capability that is usable or can be made usable, other than any of the following: (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: “Authentication”;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Digital signature;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Data integrity;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Non-repudiation;

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: Digital rights management, including the execution of copy-protected “software”;

subparagraph.name: f
subparagraph.content: Encryption or decryption in support of entertainment, mass commercial broadcasts or medical records management;

subparagraph.name: g
subparagraph.content: Wireless “personal area network” functionality implementing only published or commercial cryptographic standards; (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: h
subparagraph.content: Cryptographic operations specially designed for and limited to banking use or money transactions, including the collection and settlement of fares or credit functions; (L.N. 6 of 2025)
Key management in support of and limited to functions and capabilities described in paragraphs (a) to (h) of this Note; (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: j
subparagraph.content: Cryptographic functions or capabilities that have not been activated or enabled, and can only be activated or enabled by means of secure “cryptographic activation”. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.continued: For ‘cryptographic activation token’ items, see 5A002(b), 5D002(b) and 5E002(b). (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.leadIn: For the purposes of 5A002(a), ‘described security algorithm’ means any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: A “symmetric algorithm” employing a key length in excess of 56 bits, not including parity bits;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: An “asymmetric algorithm” where the security of the algorithm is based on any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Factorization of integers in excess of 512 bits (e.g. RSA);

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.leadIn: An “asymmetric algorithm” where the security of the algorithm is based on any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Finding isogenies between Supersingular elliptic curves (e.g. Supersingular Isogeny Key Encapsulation);
Decoding random codes (e.g. McEliece, Niederreiter).

subparagraph.continued: An algorithm described by Technical Note 2(c) may be referred to as being post-quantum, quantum-safe or quantum-resistant.

subparagraph.leadIn: When necessary as determined by the appropriate authority in the exporter’s country, details of items must be accessible and provided to the authority on request, in order to establish any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Whether the item meets the criteria of 5A002(a)(1) to 5A002(a)(4);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Whether the ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ is usable without secure “cryptographic activation”. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.leadIn: 5A002(a) does not control any of the following items, or specially designed “information security” components of those items:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.leadIn: Smart cards and smart card ‘readers/writers’ as follows:
A smart card or an electronically readable personal document (e.g. token coin, e-passport) that meets any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.leadIn: The ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ meets all of the following: (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: It is restricted for use in equipment or systems to which 5A002(a) does not apply for reasons other than the Cryptography Note (Note 3 in Category 5—Part 2); (L.N. 6 of 2025)
It cannot be reprogrammed for any other use;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Having all of the following:

subparagraph.content: Where the ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ is not user-accessible; (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.continued: ‘Personal data’ includes any data specific to a particular person or entity, such as the amount of money stored and data necessary for “authentication”.

subparagraph.content: ‘Readers/writers’ include equipment that communicates with smart cards or electronically readable documents through a network.

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: See paragraph (h) of Technical Note 1 to 5A002(a) for items previously described in this Note 2(b). (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.leadIn: Portable or mobile radiotelephones designed for civil use, other than satellite telephones, that are not capable of any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Passing encrypted data through RAN equipment (e.g. Radio Network Controller (RNC) or Base Station Controller (BSC)); (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Cordless telephone equipment not capable of end-to-end encryption where the maximum effective range of unboosted cordless operation (i.e. a single, unrelayed hop between terminal and home base station) is less than 400 metres according to the manufacturer’s specifications;

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.leadIn: Portable or mobile radiotelephones and similar client wireless devices, designed for civil use, that have been customized for a specific civil industry application, meeting all of the following:

subparagraph.content: The ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ of the non-customised devices is not affected by the customisation, and implements only published or commercial cryptographic standards; (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: f
subparagraph.continued: See paragraph (g) of Technical Note 1 to 5A002(a) for items previously described in this Note 2(f). (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: g
subparagraph.content: Mobile telecommunications Radio Access Network (RAN) equipment designed for civil use, which also meet the provisions of paragraphs (a)(2) to (4) of the Cryptography Note (Note 3 in Category 5—Part 2), having an RF output power limited to 0.1 W (20 dBm) or less, and supporting 32 or fewer concurrent users; (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: h
subparagraph.content: Routers, switches, gateways or relays, where the ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ is limited to the tasks of “Operations, Administration or Maintenance” (“OAM”) implementing only published or commercial cryptographic standards; (L.N. 85 of 2023; L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.leadIn: General purpose computing equipment or servers, where the ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ meets all of the following: (L.N. 6 of 2025)
Is any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Integral to a CPU that meets the provisions of Note 3 in Category 5— Part 2;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Integral to an operating system to which 5D002 does not apply;

subparagraph.name: c
j
subparagraph.leadIn: Items specially designed for a ‘connected civil industry application’, meeting all of the following:
Being any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.leadIn: A network-capable end-point device meeting any of the following:

subparagraph.content: The ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ is limited to securing ‘non-arbitrary data’ or the tasks of “Operations, Administration or Maintenance” (“OAM”);
The device is limited to a specific ‘connected civil industry application’;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Networking equipment meeting all of the following:

subparagraph.content: The ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ is limited to supporting the ‘connected civil industry application’ of devices specified in paragraph (j)(1)(a) of this Note, or the tasks of “OAM” of this networking equipment or of other items specified in paragraph (j) of this Note;

Where the ‘cryptography for data confidentiality’ having a ‘described security algorithm’ implements only published or commercial cryptographic standards, and the cryptographic functionality cannot easily be changed by the user. (L.N. 6 of 2025)

‘Connected civil industry application’ means a network-connected consumer or civil industry application other than “information security”, digital communication, general purpose networking or computing.

‘Non-arbitrary data’ means sensor or metering data directly related to the stability, performance or physical measurement of a system (e.g. temperature, pressure, flow rate, mass, volume, voltage, physical location, etc.), that cannot be changed by the user of the device.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Being a ‘cryptographic activation token’;

continued.leadIn: A ‘cryptographic activation token’ is an item designed or modified for any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Converting, by means of “cryptographic activation”, an item not specified in Category 5—Part 2 into an item specified in 5A002(a) or 5D002(c)(1), and not released by the Cryptography Note (Note 3 in Category 5—Part 2);
Enabling, by means of “cryptographic activation”, additional functionality specified in 5A002(a) of an item already specified in Category 5—Part 2.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Designed or modified to use or perform “quantum cryptography”;
“Quantum cryptography” is also known as Quantum Key Distribution (QKD).

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Designed or modified to use cryptographic techniques to generate channelizing codes, scrambling codes or network identification codes, for systems using ultra-wideband modulation techniques and having any of the following:

subparagraph.content: A bandwidth exceeding 500 MHz;
A “fractional bandwidth” of 20% or more;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Designed or modified to use cryptographic techniques to generate the spreading code for “spread spectrum” systems, other than those specified in 5A002(d), including the hopping code for “frequency hopping” systems;

subsection.leadIn: Systems, equipment and components, for non-cryptographic “information security”, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Communications cable systems designed or modified to use mechanical, electrical or electronic means to detect surreptitious intrusion; (L.N. 85 of 2023)
5A003(a) only controls physical layer security. For the purposes of 5A003(a), the physical layer includes Layer 1 of the Reference Model of Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) (ISO/IEC 7498-1).

paragraph.name: b

subsection.leadIn: Systems, equipment and components, for defeating, weakening or by-passing “information security”, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Designed or modified to perform ‘cryptanalytic functions’;
5A004(a) includes systems or equipment, designed or modified to perform ‘cryptanalytic functions’ by means of reverse engineering.
‘Cryptanalytic functions’ are functions designed to defeat cryptographic mechanisms in order to derive confidential variables or sensitive data, including clear text, passwords or cryptographic keys.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Items, not specified in 4A005 or 5A004(a), designed to perform all of the following:

subparagraph.content: ‘Extract raw data’ from a computing or communications device;

paragraph.continued: ‘Extract raw data’ from a computing or communications device means to retrieve binary data from a storage medium (e.g., RAM, flash or hard disk) of the device without interpretation by the device’s operating system or file system.

subparagraph.content: 5A004(b) does not control systems or equipment specially designed for the “development” or “production” of a computing or communications device.

subparagraph.leadIn: 5A004(b) does not include any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Debuggers, hypervisors;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Items limited to logical data extraction;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Data extraction items using chip-off or JTAG;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: Items specially designed and limited to jailbreaking or rooting. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

section.name: s0-4
section.content: Test, Inspection and Production Equipment (L.N. 65 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: “Information security” test, inspection and “production” equipment, as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Equipment specially designed for the “development” or “production” of equipment specified in 5A002, 5A003, 5A004 or 5B002(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Measuring equipment specially designed to evaluate and validate the “information security” functions of the equipment specified in 5A002, 5A003 or 5A004, or of “software” specified in 5D002(a) or 5D002(c);

section.name: s0-6
section.content: Materials
None;

section.name: s0-7
section.content: Software

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: “Software” specially designed or modified for the “development”, “production” or “use” of any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Equipment specified in 5A002 or “software” specified in 5D002(c)(1);
Equipment specified in 5A003 or “software” specified in 5D002(c)(2);

subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment or “software”, as follows:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Equipment specified in 5A004(a) or “software” specified in 5D002(c)(3)(a);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Equipment specified in 5A004(b) or “software” specified in 5D002(c)(3)(b); (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Software” having the characteristics of a ‘cryptographic activation token’ specified in 5A002(b); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: “Software” having the characteristics of, or performing or simulating the functions of, any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Equipment specified in 5A002(a), 5A002(c), 5A002(d) or 5A002(e);
5D002(c)(1) does not control “software” limited to the tasks of “OAM” implementing only published or commercial cryptographic standards.
Equipment specified in 5A003;

subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment, as follows:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Equipment specified in 5A004(a);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Equipment specified in 5A004(b);
5D002(c)(3)(b) does not control “intrusion software”. (L.N. 85 of 2023)

section.name: s0-9
section.content: Technology

subsection.leadIn: “Technology” as follows:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Technology” according to the General Technology Note for the “development”, “production” or “use” of equipment specified by 5A002, 5A003, 5A004 or 5B002, or of “software” specified by 5D002(a) or 5D002(c); (L.N. 89 of 2021)
5E002(a) does not control “technology” for items specified in 5A004(b), 5D002(a)(3)(b) or 5D002(c)(3)(b). (L.N. 85 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Technology” having the characteristics of a ‘cryptographic activation token’ specified in 5A002(b); (L.N. 89 of 2021)

subsection.continued: 5E002 includes “information security” technical data resulting from procedures carried out to evaluate or determine the implementation of functions, features or techniques specified in Category 5—Part 2. (L.N. 89 of 2013)

section.name: s0
section.content: Systems, Equipment and Components

subsection.leadIn: Acoustic system, equipment and components, as follows: (L.N. 161 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Marine acoustic systems, equipment and specially designed components therefor, as follows:

subparagraph.leadIn: Active (transmitting or transmitting-and-receiving) systems, equipment and specially designed components therefor, as follows:
6A001(a)(1) does not control equipment as follows: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Depth sounders operating vertically below the apparatus, not including a scanning function exceeding +20°, and limited to measuring the depth of water, the distance of submerged or buried objects or fish finding;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Acoustic beacons, as follows:

subparagraph.content: Acoustic emergency beacons;
Pingers specially designed for relocating or returning to an underwater position.

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.leadIn: Acoustic seabed survey equipment as follows:
Surface vessel survey equipment designed for seabed topographic mapping and having all of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Designed to take measurements at an angle exceeding 20° from the vertical;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Designed to measure seabed topography at seabed depths exceeding 600 m;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: ‘Sounding resolution’ less than 2; and

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.leadIn: ‘Enhancement’ of the depth “accuracy” through compensation for all of the following: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: Motion of the acoustic sensor;
In-water propagation from sensor to the seabed and back; and
Sound speed at the sensor;
‘Sounding resolution’ is the swath width (degrees) divided by the maximum number of soundings per swath.
‘Enhancement’ includes the ability to compensate by external means.

subparagraph.leadIn: Underwater survey equipment designed for seabed topographic mapping and meeting any of the following descriptions: (L.N. 42 of 2017)
The acoustic sensor pressure rating determines the depth rating of the underwater survey equipment specified in 6A001(a)(1)(a)(2).

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.leadIn: It meets both of the following descriptions:

subparagraph.content: Designed or modified to operate at depths exceeding 300 m;
‘Sounding rate’ greater than 3 800 m/s;

‘Sounding rate’ is the product of the maximum speed (m/s) at which the sensor can operate and the maximum number of soundings per swath assuming 100% coverage. For systems that produce soundings in 2 directions (3D sonars), the maximum of the ‘sounding rate’ in either direction is to be used for the purposes of 6A001(a)(1)(a)(2)(a)(2).

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: It is not specified in 6A001(a)(1)(a)(2)(a) and meets all of the following descriptions:

subparagraph.content: Designed or modified to operate at depths exceeding 100 m;
Designed to take measurements at an angle exceeding 20° from the vertical;

subparagraph.leadIn: Meets either of the following descriptions:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Operating frequency below 350 kHz;

subparagraph.name: b

subparagraph.leadIn: ‘Enhancement’ of the depth “accuracy” through compensation of all of the following: (L.N. 85 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Motion of the acoustic sensor;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: In-water propagation from sensor to the seabed and back;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: Sound speed at the sensor; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.leadIn: Side Scan Sonar (SSS) or Synthetic Aperture Sonar (SAS), designed for seabed imaging and having all of the following, and specially designed transmitting and receiving acoustic arrays for such sonars: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Designed or modified to operate at depths exceeding 500 m; (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: An ‘area coverage rate’ of greater than 570 m2/s while operating at the maximum range that it can operate with an ‘along track resolution’ of less than 15 cm; (L.N. 161 of 2011; L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: b

subparagraph.content: ‘Area coverage rate’ (m2/s) is twice the product of the sonar range (m) and the maximum speed (m/s) at which the sensor can operate at that range.
‘Along track resolution’ (cm), for SSS only, is the product of azimuth (horizontal) beamwidth (degrees) and sonar range (m) and 0.873.
‘Across track resolution’ (cm) is 75 divided by the signal bandwidth (kHz). (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Systems or transmitting and receiving arrays, designed for object detection or location, having any of the following: (L.N. 89 of 2013)

subparagraph.content: A transmitting frequency below 10 kHz;
Forming beams of less than 1° on any axis and having an operating frequency of less than 100 kHz;
Designed to operate with an unambiguous display range exceeding 5 120 m; or

subparagraph.leadIn: Designed to withstand pressure during normal operation at depths exceeding 1 000 m and having transducers with any of the following:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Dynamic compensation for pressure; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Incorporating other than lead zirconate titanate as the transduction element;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.leadIn: Acoustic projectors, including transducers, incorporating piezoelectric, magnetostrictive, electrostrictive, electrodynamic or hydraulic elements operating individually or in a designed combination, and having any of the following: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: The control status of acoustic projectors, including transducers, specially designed for other equipment not specified in 6A001, is determined by the control status of the other equipment. (L.N. 42 of 2017)
6A001(a)(1)(c) does not control electronic sources which direct the sound vertically only, or mechanical (e.g. air gun or vapour-shock gun) or chemical (e.g. explosive) sources. (E.R. 6 of 2020)

Piezoelectric elements specified in 6A001(a)(1)(c) include those made from lead-magnesium-niobate/lead-titanate (Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-PbTiO3, or PMN-PT) single crystals grown from solid solution or lead-indium-niobate/lead-magnesium niobate/lead-titanate (Pb(In1/2Nb1/2)O3-Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-PbTiO3, or PIN-PMN- PT) single crystals grown from solid solution. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.leadIn: Operating at frequencies below 10 kHz and meeting either of the following descriptions:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Not designed for continuous operation at 100% duty cycle and having a radiated ‘free-field Source Level (SLRMS)’ exceeding (10 log(f) + 169.77) dB (reference 1 μPa at 1 m), where f is the frequency in Hertz of the maximum Transmitting Voltage Response (TVR) below 10 kHz;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: Designed for continuous operation at 100% duty cycle and having a continuously radiated ‘free-field Source Level (SLRMS)’ at 100% duty cycle exceeding (10 log(f) + 159.77) dB (reference 1 μPa at 1 m), where f is the frequency in Hertz of the maximum Transmitting Voltage Response (TVR) below 10 kHz;

subparagraph.continued: The ‘free-field Source Level (SLRMS)’ is defined along the maximum response axis and in the far field of an acoustic projector. It can be obtained from the TVR using the following equation: SLRMS = (TVR + 20 log VRMS) dB (reference 1 μPa at 1 m), where SLRMS is the source level, TVR is the Transmitting Voltage Response and VRMS is the Driving Voltage of the Projector. (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.leadIn: Side-lobe suppression exceeding 22 dB; (L.N. 132 of 2001)

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.leadIn: Acoustic systems and equipment, designed to determine the position of surface vessels or submersible vehicles and having all of the following, and specially designed components therefor: (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: Detection range exceeding 1 000 m;

subparagraph.continued: 6A001(a)(1)(d) includes:

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: Equipment using coherent “signal processing” between two or more beacons and the hydrophone unit carried by the surface vessel or submersible vehicle; (L.N. 6 of 2025)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: Equipment capable of automatically correcting speed-of-sound propagation errors for calculation of a point. (L.N. 161 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.leadIn: Active individual sonars, specially designed or modified to detect, locate and automatically classify swimmers or divers, having all of the following, and specially designed transmitting and receiving acoustic arrays for such sonars: (L.N. 42 of 2017)

subparagraph.content: Detection range exceeding 530 m;
